                     <div class="line">but a kind of hard conscience, to offer to counsel</div>
                     <div class="line">me to stay with the Jew. The fiend gives the more</div>
                     <div class="line">friendly counsel: I will run, fiend; my heels are</div>
                     <div class="line">at your command; I will run.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter Old GOBBO, with a basket</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GOBBO</div>
                     <div class="line">Master young man, you, I pray you, which is the way</div>
                     <div class="line">to master Jew's?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAUNCELOT</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Aside</span>  O heavens, this is my true-begotten father!</div>
                     <div class="line">who, being more than sand-blind, high-gravel blind,</div>
                     <div class="line">knows me not: I will try confusions with him.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GOBBO</div>
                     <div class="line">Master young gentleman, I pray you, which is the way</div>
                     <div class="line">to master Jew's?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAUNCELOT</div>
                     <div class="line">Turn up on your right hand at the next turning, but,</div>
                     <div class="line">at the next turning of all, on your left; marry, at</div>
                     <div class="line">the very next turning, turn of no hand, but turn</div>
                     <div class="line">down indirectly to the Jew's house.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GOBBO</div>
                     <div class="line">By God's sonties, 'twill be a hard way to hit. Can</div>
                     <div class="line">you tell me whether one Launcelot,</div>
                     <div class="line">that dwells with him, dwell with him or no?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAUNCELOT</div>
                     <div class="line">Talk you of young Master Launcelot?</div>
                     <p>Aside</p>
                     <div class="line">Mark me now; now will I raise the waters. Talk you</div>
                     <div class="line">of young Master Launcelot?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GOBBO</div>
                     <div class="line">No master, sir, but a poor man's son: his father,</div>
                     <div class="line">though I say it, is an honest exceeding poor man</div>
                     <div class="line">and, God be thanked, well to live.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAUNCELOT</div>
                     <div class="line">Well, let his father be what a' will, we talk of</div>
                     <div class="line">young Master Launcelot.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GOBBO</div>
                     <div class="line">Your worship's friend and Launcelot, sir.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAUNCELOT</div>
                     <div class="line">But I pray you, ergo, old man, ergo, I beseech you,</div>
                     <div class="line">talk you of young Master Launcelot?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GOBBO</div>
                     <div class="line">Of Launcelot, an't please your mastership.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAUNCELOT</div>
                     <div class="line">Ergo, Master Launcelot. Talk not of Master</div>
                     <div class="line">Launcelot, father; for the young gentleman,</div>
                     <div class="line">according to Fates and Destinies and such odd</div>
                     <div class="line">sayings, the Sisters Three and such branches of</div>
                     <div class="line">learning, is indeed deceased, or, as you would say</div>
                     <div class="line">in plain terms, gone to heaven.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GOBBO</div>
                     <div class="line">Marry, God forbid! the boy was the very staff of my</div>
                     <div class="line">age, my very prop.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAUNCELOT</div>
                     <div class="line">Do I look like a cudgel or a hovel-post, a staff or</div>
                     <div class="line">a prop? Do you know me, father?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GOBBO</div>
                     <div class="line">Alack the day, I know you not, young gentleman:</div>
                     <div class="line">but, I pray you, tell me, is my boy, God rest his</div>
                     <div class="line">soul, alive or dead?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAUNCELOT</div>
                     <div class="line">Do you not know me, father?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GOBBO</div>
                     <div class="line">Alack, sir, I am sand-blind; I know you not.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAUNCELOT</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, indeed, if you had your eyes, you might fail of</div>
                     <div class="line">the knowing me: it is a wise father that knows his</div>
                     <div class="line">own child. Well, old man, I will tell you news of</div>
                     <div class="line">your son: give me your blessing: truth will come</div>
                     <div class="line">to light; murder cannot be hid long; a man's son</div>
                     <div class="line">may, but at the length truth will out.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GOBBO</div>
                     <div class="line">Pray you, sir, stand up: I am sure you are not</div>
                     <div class="line">Launcelot, my boy.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAUNCELOT</div>
                     <div class="line">Pray you, let's have no more fooling about it, but</div>
                     <div class="line">give me your blessing: I am Launcelot, your boy</div>
                     <div class="line">that was, your son that is, your child that shall</div>
                     <div class="line">be.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GOBBO</div>
                     <div class="line">I cannot think you are my son.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAUNCELOT</div>
                     <div class="line">I know not what I shall think of that: but I am</div>
                     <div class="line">Launcelot, the Jew's man, and I am sure Margery your</div>
                     <div class="line">wife is my mother.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GOBBO</div>
                     <div class="line">Her name is Margery, indeed: I'll be sworn, if thou</div>
                     <div class="line">be Launcelot, thou art mine own flesh and blood.</div>
                     <div class="line">Lord worshipped might he be! what a beard hast thou</div>
                     <div class="line">got! thou hast got more hair on thy chin than</div>
                     <div class="line">Dobbin my fill-horse has on his tail.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAUNCELOT</div>
                     <div class="line">It should seem, then, that Dobbin's tail grows</div>
                     <div class="line">backward: I am sure he had more hair of his tail</div>
                     <div class="line">than I have of my face when I last saw him.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GOBBO</div>
                     <div class="line">Lord, how art thou changed! How dost thou and thy</div>
                     <div class="line">master agree? I have brought him a present. How</div>
                     <div class="line">'gree you now?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAUNCELOT</div>
                     <div class="line">Well, well: but, for mine own part, as I have set</div>
                     <div class="line">up my rest to run away, so I will not rest till I</div>
                     <div class="line">have run some ground. My master's a very Jew: give</div>
                     <div class="line">him a present! give him a halter: I am famished in</div>
                     <div class="line">his service; you may tell every finger I have with</div>
                     <div class="line">my ribs. Father, I am glad you are come: give me</div>
                     <div class="line">your present to one Master Bassanio, who, indeed,</div>
                     <div class="line">gives rare new liveries: if I serve not him, I</div>
                     <div class="line">will run as far as God has any ground. O rare</div>
                     <div class="line">fortune! here comes the man: to him, father; for I</div>
                     <div class="line">am a Jew, if I serve the Jew any longer.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter BASSANIO, with LEONARDO and other followers</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BASSANIO</div>
                     <div class="line">You may do so; but let it be so hasted that supper</div>
                     <div class="line">be ready at the farthest by five of the clock. See</div>
                     <div class="line">these letters delivered; put the liveries to making,</div>
                     <div class="line">and desire Gratiano to come anon to my lodging.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit a Servant</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAUNCELOT</div>
                     <div class="line">To him, father.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GOBBO</div>
                     <div class="line">God bless your worship!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BASSANIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Gramercy! wouldst thou aught with me?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GOBBO</div>
                     <div class="line">Here's my son, sir, a poor boy,--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAUNCELOT</div>
                     <div class="line">Not a poor boy, sir, but the rich Jew's man; that</div>
                     <div class="line">would, sir, as my father shall specify--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GOBBO</div>
                     <div class="line">He hath a great infection, sir, as one would say, to serve--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAUNCELOT</div>
                     <div class="line">Indeed, the short and the long is, I serve the Jew,</div>
                     <div class="line">and have a desire, as my father shall specify--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GOBBO</div>
                     <div class="line">His master and he, saving your worship's reverence,</div>
                     <div class="line">are scarce cater-cousins--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAUNCELOT</div>
                     <div class="line">To be brief, the very truth is that the Jew, having</div>
                     <div class="line">done me wrong, doth cause me, as my father, being, I</div>
                     <div class="line">hope, an old man, shall frutify unto you--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GOBBO</div>
                     <div class="line">I have here a dish of doves that I would bestow upon</div>
                     <div class="line">your worship, and my suit is--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAUNCELOT</div>
                     <div class="line">In very brief, the suit is impertinent to myself, as</div>
                     <div class="line">your worship shall know by this honest old man; and,</div>
                     <div class="line">though I say it, though old man, yet poor man, my father.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BASSANIO</div>
                     <div class="line">One speak for both. What would you?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAUNCELOT</div>
                     <div class="line">Serve you, sir.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GOBBO</div>
                     <div class="line">That is the very defect of the matter, sir.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BASSANIO</div>
                     <div class="line">I know thee well; thou hast obtain'd thy suit:</div>
                     <div class="line">Shylock thy master spoke with me this day,</div>
                     <div class="line">And hath preferr'd thee, if it be preferment</div>
                     <div class="line">To leave a rich Jew's service, to become</div>
                     <div class="line">The follower of so poor a gentleman.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAUNCELOT</div>
                     <div class="line">The old proverb is very well parted between my</div>
                     <div class="line">master Shylock and you, sir: you have the grace of</div>
                     <div class="line">God, sir, and he hath enough.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BASSANIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou speak'st it well. Go, father, with thy son.</div>
                     <div class="line">Take leave of thy old master and inquire</div>
                     <div class="line">My lodging out. Give him a livery</div>
                     <div class="line">More guarded than his fellows': see it done.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAUNCELOT</div>
                     <div class="line">Father, in. I cannot get a service, no; I have</div>
                     <div class="line">ne'er a tongue in my head. Well, if any man in</div>
                     <div class="line">Italy have a fairer table which doth offer to swear</div>
                     <div class="line">upon a book, I shall have good fortune. Go to,</div>
                     <div class="line">here's a simple line of life: here's a small trifle</div>
                     <div class="line">of wives: alas, fifteen wives is nothing! eleven</div>
                     <div class="line">widows and nine maids is a simple coming-in for one</div>
                     <div class="line">man: and then to 'scape drowning thrice, and to be</div>
                     <div class="line">in peril of my life with the edge of a feather-bed;</div>
                     <div class="line">here are simple scapes. Well, if Fortune be a</div>
                     <div class="line">woman, she's a good wench for this gear. Father,</div>
                     <div class="line">come; I'll take my leave of the Jew in the twinkling of an eye.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt Launcelot and Old Gobbo</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BASSANIO</div>
                     <div class="line">I pray thee, good Leonardo, think on this:</div>
                     <div class="line">These things being bought and orderly bestow'd,</div>
                     <div class="line">Return in haste, for I do feast to-night</div>
                     <div class="line">My best-esteem'd acquaintance: hie thee, go.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LEONARDO</div>
                     <div class="line">My best endeavours shall be done herein.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter GRATIANO</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GRATIANO</div>
                     <div class="line">Where is your master?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LEONARDO</div>
                     <div class="line">Yonder, sir, he walks.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GRATIANO</div>
                     <div class="line">Signior Bassanio!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BASSANIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Gratiano!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GRATIANO</div>
                     <div class="line">I have a suit to you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BASSANIO</div>
                     <div class="line">You have obtain'd it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GRATIANO</div>
                     <div class="line">You must not deny me: I must go with you to Belmont.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BASSANIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Why then you must. But hear thee, Gratiano;</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou art too wild, too rude and bold of voice;</div>
                     <div class="line">Parts that become thee happily enough</div>
                     <div class="line">And in such eyes as ours appear not faults;</div>
                     <div class="line">But where thou art not known, why, there they show</div>
                     <div class="line">Something too liberal. Pray thee, take pain</div>
                     <div class="line">To allay with some cold drops of modesty</div>
                     <div class="line">Thy skipping spirit, lest through thy wild behavior</div>
                     <div class="line">I be misconstrued in the place I go to,</div>
                     <div class="line">And lose my hopes.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GRATIANO</div>
                     <div class="line">Signior Bassanio, hear me:</div>
                     <div class="line">If I do not put on a sober habit,</div>
                     <div class="line">Talk with respect and swear but now and then,</div>
                     <div class="line">Wear prayer-books in my pocket, look demurely,</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay more, while grace is saying, hood mine eyes</div>
                     <div class="line">Thus with my hat, and sigh and say 'amen,'</div>
                     <div class="line">Use all the observance of civility,</div>
                     <div class="line">Like one well studied in a sad ostent</div>
                     <div class="line">To please his grandam, never trust me more.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BASSANIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Well, we shall see your bearing.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GRATIANO</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, but I bar to-night: you shall not gauge me</div>
                     <div class="line">By what we do to-night.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BASSANIO</div>
                     <div class="line">No, that were pity:</div>
                     <div class="line">I would entreat you rather to put on</div>
                     <div class="line">Your boldest suit of mirth, for we have friends</div>
                     <div class="line">That purpose merriment. But fare you well:</div>
                     <div class="line">I have some business.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GRATIANO</div>
                     <div class="line">And I must to Lorenzo and the rest:</div>
                     <div class="line">But we will visit you at supper-time.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.4.4">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>3. SCENE III.  The same. A room in SHYLOCK'S house.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter JESSICA and LAUNCELOT</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JESSICA</div>
                     <div class="line">I am sorry thou wilt leave my father so:</div>
                     <div class="line">Our house is hell, and thou, a merry devil,</div>
                     <div class="line">Didst rob it of some taste of tediousness.</div>
                     <div class="line">But fare thee well, there is a ducat for thee:</div>
                     <div class="line">And, Launcelot, soon at supper shalt thou see</div>
                     <div class="line">Lorenzo, who is thy new master's guest:</div>
                     <div class="line">Give him this letter; do it secretly;</div>
                     <div class="line">And so farewell: I would not have my father</div>
                     <div class="line">See me in talk with thee.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAUNCELOT</div>
                     <div class="line">Adieu! tears exhibit my tongue. Most beautiful</div>
                     <div class="line">pagan, most sweet Jew! if a Christian did not play</div>
                     <div class="line">the knave and get thee, I am much deceived. But,</div>
                     <div class="line">adieu: these foolish drops do something drown my</div>
                     <div class="line">manly spirit: adieu.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JESSICA</div>
                     <div class="line">Farewell, good Launcelot.</div>
                     <p>Exit Launcelot</p>
                     <div class="line">Alack, what heinous sin is it in me</div>
                     <div class="line">To be ashamed to be my father's child!</div>
                     <div class="line">But though I am a daughter to his blood,</div>
                     <div class="line">I am not to his manners. O Lorenzo,</div>
                     <div class="line">If thou keep promise, I shall end this strife,</div>
                     <div class="line">Become a Christian and thy loving wife.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.4.5">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>4. SCENE IV.  The same. A street.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter GRATIANO, LORENZO, SALARINO, and SALANIO</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LORENZO</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, we will slink away in supper-time,</div>
                     <div class="line">Disguise us at my lodging and return,</div>
                     <div class="line">All in an hour.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GRATIANO</div>
                     <div class="line">We have not made good preparation.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SALARINO</div>
                     <div class="line">We have not spoke us yet of torchbearers.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SALANIO</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis vile, unless it may be quaintly order'd,</div>
                     <div class="line">And better in my mind not undertook.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LORENZO</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis now but four o'clock: we have two hours</div>
                     <div class="line">To furnish us.</div>
                     <p>Enter LAUNCELOT, with a letter</p>
                     <div class="line">Friend Launcelot, what's the news?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAUNCELOT</div>
                     <div class="line">An it shall please you to break up</div>
                     <div class="line">this, it shall seem to signify.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LORENZO</div>
                     <div class="line">I know the hand: in faith, 'tis a fair hand;</div>
                     <div class="line">And whiter than the paper it writ on</div>
                     <div class="line">Is the fair hand that writ.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GRATIANO</div>
                     <div class="line">Love-news, in faith.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAUNCELOT</div>
                     <div class="line">By your leave, sir.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LORENZO</div>
                     <div class="line">Whither goest thou?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAUNCELOT</div>
                     <div class="line">Marry, sir, to bid my old master the</div>
                     <div class="line">Jew to sup to-night with my new master the Christian.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LORENZO</div>
                     <div class="line">Hold here, take this: tell gentle Jessica</div>
                     <div class="line">I will not fail her; speak it privately.</div>
                     <div class="line">Go, gentlemen,</div>
                     <p>Exit Launcelot</p>
                     <div class="line">Will you prepare you for this masque tonight?</div>
                     <div class="line">I am provided of a torch-bearer.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SALANIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, marry, I'll be gone about it straight.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SALANIO</div>
                     <div class="line">And so will I.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LORENZO</div>
                     <div class="line">Meet me and Gratiano</div>
                     <div class="line">At Gratiano's lodging some hour hence.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SALARINO</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis good we do so.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt SALARINO and SALANIO</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GRATIANO</div>
                     <div class="line">Was not that letter from fair Jessica?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LORENZO</div>
                     <div class="line">I must needs tell thee all. She hath directed</div>
                     <div class="line">How I shall take her from her father's house,</div>
                     <div class="line">What gold and jewels she is furnish'd with,</div>
                     <div class="line">What page's suit she hath in readiness.</div>
                     <div class="line">If e'er the Jew her father come to heaven,</div>
                     <div class="line">It will be for his gentle daughter's sake:</div>
                     <div class="line">And never dare misfortune cross her foot,</div>
                     <div class="line">Unless she do it under this excuse,</div>
                     <div class="line">That she is issue to a faithless Jew.</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, go with me; peruse this as thou goest:</div>
                     <div class="line">Fair Jessica shall be my torch-bearer.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.4.6">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>5. SCENE V.  The same. Before SHYLOCK'S house.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter SHYLOCK and LAUNCELOT</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SHYLOCK</div>
                     <div class="line">Well, thou shalt see, thy eyes shall be thy judge,</div>
                     <div class="line">The difference of old Shylock and Bassanio:--</div>
                     <div class="line">What, Jessica!--thou shalt not gormandise,</div>
                     <div class="line">As thou hast done with me:--What, Jessica!--</div>
                     <div class="line">And sleep and snore, and rend apparel out;--</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, Jessica, I say!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAUNCELOT</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, Jessica!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SHYLOCK</div>
                     <div class="line">Who bids thee call? I do not bid thee call.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAUNCELOT</div>
                     <div class="line">Your worship was wont to tell me that</div>
                     <div class="line">I could do nothing without bidding.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter Jessica</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JESSICA</div>
                     <div class="line">Call you? what is your will?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SHYLOCK</div>
                     <div class="line">I am bid forth to supper, Jessica:</div>
                     <div class="line">There are my keys. But wherefore should I go?</div>
                     <div class="line">I am not bid for love; they flatter me:</div>
                     <div class="line">But yet I'll go in hate, to feed upon</div>
                     <div class="line">The prodigal Christian. Jessica, my girl,</div>
                     <div class="line">Look to my house. I am right loath to go:</div>
                     <div class="line">There is some ill a-brewing towards my rest,</div>
                     <div class="line">For I did dream of money-bags to-night.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAUNCELOT</div>
                     <div class="line">I beseech you, sir, go: my young master doth expect</div>
                     <div class="line">your reproach.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SHYLOCK</div>
                     <div class="line">So do I his.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAUNCELOT</div>
                     <div class="line">An they have conspired together, I will not say you</div>
                     <div class="line">shall see a masque; but if you do, then it was not</div>
                     <div class="line">for nothing that my nose fell a-bleeding on</div>
                     <div class="line">Black-Monday last at six o'clock i' the morning,</div>
                     <div class="line">falling out that year on Ash-Wednesday was four</div>
                     <div class="line">year, in the afternoon.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SHYLOCK</div>
                     <div class="line">What, are there masques? Hear you me, Jessica:</div>
                     <div class="line">Lock up my doors; and when you hear the drum</div>
                     <div class="line">And the vile squealing of the wry-neck'd fife,</div>
                     <div class="line">Clamber not you up to the casements then,</div>
                     <div class="line">Nor thrust your head into the public street</div>
                     <div class="line">To gaze on Christian fools with varnish'd faces,</div>
                     <div class="line">But stop my house's ears, I mean my casements:</div>
                     <div class="line">Let not the sound of shallow foppery enter</div>
                     <div class="line">My sober house. By Jacob's staff, I swear,</div>
                     <div class="line">I have no mind of feasting forth to-night:</div>
                     <div class="line">But I will go. Go you before me, sirrah;</div>
                     <div class="line">Say I will come.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAUNCELOT</div>
                     <div class="line">I will go before, sir. Mistress, look out at</div>
                     <div class="line">window, for all this, There will come a Christian</div>
                     <div class="line">boy, will be worth a Jewess' eye.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SHYLOCK</div>
                     <div class="line">What says that fool of Hagar's offspring, ha?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JESSICA</div>
                     <div class="line">His words were 'Farewell mistress;' nothing else.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SHYLOCK</div>
                     <div class="line">The patch is kind enough, but a huge feeder;</div>
                     <div class="line">Snail-slow in profit, and he sleeps by day</div>
                     <div class="line">More than the wild-cat: drones hive not with me;</div>
                     <div class="line">Therefore I part with him, and part with him</div>
                     <div class="line">To one that would have him help to waste</div>
                     <div class="line">His borrow'd purse. Well, Jessica, go in;</div>
                     <div class="line">Perhaps I will return immediately:</div>
                     <div class="line">Do as I bid you; shut doors after you:</div>
                     <div class="line">Fast bind, fast find;</div>
                     <div class="line">A proverb never stale in thrifty mind.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JESSICA</div>
                     <div class="line">Farewell; and if my fortune be not crost,</div>
                     <div class="line">I have a father, you a daughter, lost.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.4.7">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>6. SCENE VI.  The same.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter GRATIANO and SALARINO, masqued</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GRATIANO</div>
                     <div class="line">This is the pent-house under which Lorenzo</div>
                     <div class="line">Desired us to make stand.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SALARINO</div>
                     <div class="line">His hour is almost past.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GRATIANO</div>
                     <div class="line">And it is marvel he out-dwells his hour,</div>
                     <div class="line">For lovers ever run before the clock.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SALARINO</div>
                     <div class="line">O, ten times faster Venus' pigeons fly</div>
                     <div class="line">To seal love's bonds new-made, than they are wont</div>
                     <div class="line">To keep obliged faith unforfeited!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GRATIANO</div>
                     <div class="line">That ever holds: who riseth from a feast</div>
                     <div class="line">With that keen appetite that he sits down?</div>
                     <div class="line">Where is the horse that doth untread again</div>
                     <div class="line">His tedious measures with the unbated fire</div>
                     <div class="line">That he did pace them first? All things that are,</div>
                     <div class="line">Are with more spirit chased than enjoy'd.</div>
                     <div class="line">How like a younker or a prodigal</div>
                     <div class="line">The scarfed bark puts from her native bay,</div>
                     <div class="line">Hugg'd and embraced by the strumpet wind!</div>
                     <div class="line">How like the prodigal doth she return,</div>
                     <div class="line">With over-weather'd ribs and ragged sails,</div>
                     <div class="line">Lean, rent and beggar'd by the strumpet wind!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SALARINO</div>
                     <div class="line">Here comes Lorenzo: more of this hereafter.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter LORENZO</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LORENZO</div>
                     <div class="line">Sweet friends, your patience for my long abode;</div>
                     <div class="line">Not I, but my affairs, have made you wait:</div>
                     <div class="line">When you shall please to play the thieves for wives,</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll watch as long for you then. Approach;</div>
                     <div class="line">Here dwells my father Jew. Ho! who's within?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter JESSICA, above, in boy's clothes</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JESSICA</div>
                     <div class="line">Who are you? Tell me, for more certainty,</div>
                     <div class="line">Albeit I'll swear that I do know your tongue.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LORENZO</div>
                     <div class="line">Lorenzo, and thy love.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JESSICA</div>
                     <div class="line">Lorenzo, certain, and my love indeed,</div>
                     <div class="line">For who love I so much? And now who knows</div>
                     <div class="line">But you, Lorenzo, whether I am yours?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LORENZO</div>
                     <div class="line">Heaven and thy thoughts are witness that thou art.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JESSICA</div>
                     <div class="line">Here, catch this casket; it is worth the pains.</div>
                     <div class="line">I am glad 'tis night, you do not look on me,</div>
                     <div class="line">For I am much ashamed of my exchange:</div>
                     <div class="line">But love is blind and lovers cannot see</div>
                     <div class="line">The pretty follies that themselves commit;</div>
                     <div class="line">For if they could, Cupid himself would blush</div>
                     <div class="line">To see me thus transformed to a boy.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LORENZO</div>
                     <div class="line">Descend, for you must be my torchbearer.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JESSICA</div>
                     <div class="line">What, must I hold a candle to my shames?</div>
                     <div class="line">They in themselves, good-sooth, are too too light.</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, 'tis an office of discovery, love;</div>
                     <div class="line">And I should be obscured.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LORENZO</div>
                     <div class="line">So are you, sweet,</div>
                     <div class="line">Even in the lovely garnish of a boy.</div>
                     <div class="line">But come at once;</div>
                     <div class="line">For the close night doth play the runaway,</div>
                     <div class="line">And we are stay'd for at Bassanio's feast.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JESSICA</div>
                     <div class="line">I will make fast the doors, and gild myself</div>
                     <div class="line">With some more ducats, and be with you straight.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit above</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GRATIANO</div>
                     <div class="line">Now, by my hood, a Gentile and no Jew.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LORENZO</div>
                     <div class="line">Beshrew me but I love her heartily;</div>
                     <div class="line">For she is wise, if I can judge of her,</div>
                     <div class="line">And fair she is, if that mine eyes be true,</div>
                     <div class="line">And true she is, as she hath proved herself,</div>
                     <div class="line">And therefore, like herself, wise, fair and true,</div>
                     <div class="line">Shall she be placed in my constant soul.</div>
                     <p>Enter JESSICA, below</p>
                     <div class="line">What, art thou come? On, gentlemen; away!</div>
                     <div class="line">Our masquing mates by this time for us stay.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit with Jessica and Salarino</p>
               <p>Enter ANTONIO</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ANTONIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Who's there?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GRATIANO</div>
                     <div class="line">Signior Antonio!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ANTONIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Fie, fie, Gratiano! where are all the rest?</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis nine o'clock: our friends all stay for you.</div>
                     <div class="line">No masque to-night: the wind is come about;</div>
                     <div class="line">Bassanio presently will go aboard:</div>
                     <div class="line">I have sent twenty out to seek for you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GRATIANO</div>
                     <div class="line">I am glad on't: I desire no more delight</div>
                     <div class="line">Than to be under sail and gone to-night.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.4.8">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>7. SCENE VII.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Flourish of cornets. Enter PORTIA, with the
PRINCE OF MOROCCO, and their trains</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PORTIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Go draw aside the curtains and discover</div>
                     <div class="line">The several caskets to this noble prince.</div>
                     <div class="line">Now make your choice.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MOROCCO</div>
                     <div class="line">The first, of gold, who this inscription bears,</div>
                     <div class="line">'Who chooseth me shall gain what many men desire;'</div>
                     <div class="line">The second, silver, which this promise carries,</div>
                     <div class="line">'Who chooseth me shall get as much as he deserves;'</div>
                     <div class="line">This third, dull lead, with warning all as blunt,</div>
                     <div class="line">'Who chooseth me must give and hazard all he hath.'</div>
                     <div class="line">How shall I know if I do choose the right?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PORTIA</div>
                     <div class="line">The one of them contains my picture, prince:</div>
                     <div class="line">If you choose that, then I am yours withal.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MOROCCO</div>
                     <div class="line">Some god direct my judgment! Let me see;</div>
                     <div class="line">I will survey the inscriptions back again.</div>
                     <div class="line">What says this leaden casket?</div>
                     <div class="line">'Who chooseth me must give and hazard all he hath.'</div>
                     <div class="line">Must give: for what? for lead? hazard for lead?</div>
                     <div class="line">This casket threatens. Men that hazard all</div>
                     <div class="line">Do it in hope of fair advantages:</div>
                     <div class="line">A golden mind stoops not to shows of dross;</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll then nor give nor hazard aught for lead.</div>
                     <div class="line">What says the silver with her virgin hue?</div>
                     <div class="line">'Who chooseth me shall get as much as he deserves.'</div>
                     <div class="line">As much as he deserves! Pause there, Morocco,</div>
                     <div class="line">And weigh thy value with an even hand:</div>
                     <div class="line">If thou be'st rated by thy estimation,</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou dost deserve enough; and yet enough</div>
                     <div class="line">May not extend so far as to the lady:</div>
                     <div class="line">And yet to be afeard of my deserving</div>
                     <div class="line">Were but a weak disabling of myself.</div>
                     <div class="line">As much as I deserve! Why, that's the lady:</div>
                     <div class="line">I do in birth deserve her, and in fortunes,</div>
                     <div class="line">In graces and in qualities of breeding;</div>
                     <div class="line">But more than these, in love I do deserve.</div>
                     <div class="line">What if I stray'd no further, but chose here?</div>
                     <div class="line">Let's see once more this saying graved in gold</div>
                     <div class="line">'Who chooseth me shall gain what many men desire.'</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, that's the lady; all the world desires her;</div>
                     <div class="line">From the four corners of the earth they come,</div>
                     <div class="line">To kiss this shrine, this mortal-breathing saint:</div>
                     <div class="line">The Hyrcanian deserts and the vasty wilds</div>
                     <div class="line">Of wide Arabia are as thoroughfares now</div>
                     <div class="line">For princes to come view fair Portia:</div>
                     <div class="line">The watery kingdom, whose ambitious head</div>
                     <div class="line">Spits in the face of heaven, is no bar</div>
                     <div class="line">To stop the foreign spirits, but they come,</div>
                     <div class="line">As o'er a brook, to see fair Portia.</div>
                     <div class="line">One of these three contains her heavenly picture.</div>
                     <div class="line">Is't like that lead contains her? 'Twere damnation</div>
                     <div class="line">To think so base a thought: it were too gross</div>
                     <div class="line">To rib her cerecloth in the obscure grave.</div>
                     <div class="line">Or shall I think in silver she's immured,</div>
                     <div class="line">Being ten times undervalued to tried gold?</div>
                     <div class="line">O sinful thought! Never so rich a gem</div>
                     <div class="line">Was set in worse than gold. They have in England</div>
                     <div class="line">A coin that bears the figure of an angel</div>
                     <div class="line">Stamped in gold, but that's insculp'd upon;</div>
                     <div class="line">But here an angel in a golden bed</div>
                     <div class="line">Lies all within. Deliver me the key:</div>
                     <div class="line">Here do I choose, and thrive I as I may!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PORTIA</div>
                     <div class="line">There, take it, prince; and if my form lie there,</div>
                     <div class="line">Then I am yours.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>He unlocks the golden casket</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">MOROCCO</div>
                     <div class="line">O hell! what have we here?</div>
                     <div class="line">A carrion Death, within whose empty eye</div>
                     <div class="line">There is a written scroll! I'll read the writing.</div>
                     <p>Reads</p>
                     <div class="line">All that glitters is not gold;</div>
                     <div class="line">Often have you heard that told:</div>
                     <div class="line">Many a man his life hath sold</div>
                     <div class="line">But my outside to behold:</div>
                     <div class="line">Gilded tombs do worms enfold.</div>
                     <div class="line">Had you been as wise as bold,</div>
                     <div class="line">Young in limbs, in judgment old,</div>
                     <div class="line">Your answer had not been inscroll'd:</div>
                     <div class="line">Fare you well; your suit is cold.</div>
                     <div class="line">Cold, indeed; and labour lost:</div>
                     <div class="line">Then, farewell, heat, and welcome, frost!</div>
                     <div class="line">Portia, adieu. I have too grieved a heart</div>
                     <div class="line">To take a tedious leave: thus losers part.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit with his train. Flourish of cornets</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PORTIA</div>
                     <div class="line">A gentle riddance. Draw the curtains, go.</div>
                     <div class="line">Let all of his complexion choose me so.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.4.9">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>8. SCENE VIII.  Venice. A street.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter SALARINO and SALANIO</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SALARINO</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, man, I saw Bassanio under sail:</div>
                     <div class="line">With him is Gratiano gone along;</div>
                     <div class="line">And in their ship I am sure Lorenzo is not.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SALANIO</div>
                     <div class="line">The villain Jew with outcries raised the duke,</div>
                     <div class="line">Who went with him to search Bassanio's ship.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SALARINO</div>
                     <div class="line">He came too late, the ship was under sail:</div>
                     <div class="line">But there the duke was given to understand</div>
                     <div class="line">That in a gondola were seen together</div>
                     <div class="line">Lorenzo and his amorous Jessica:</div>
                     <div class="line">Besides, Antonio certified the duke</div>
                     <div class="line">They were not with Bassanio in his ship.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SALANIO</div>
                     <div class="line">I never heard a passion so confused,</div>
                     <div class="line">So strange, outrageous, and so variable,</div>
                     <div class="line">As the dog Jew did utter in the streets:</div>
                     <div class="line">'My daughter! O my ducats! O my daughter!</div>
                     <div class="line">Fled with a Christian! O my Christian ducats!</div>
                     <div class="line">Justice! the law! my ducats, and my daughter!</div>
                     <div class="line">A sealed bag, two sealed bags of ducats,</div>
                     <div class="line">Of double ducats, stolen from me by my daughter!</div>
                     <div class="line">And jewels, two stones, two rich and precious stones,</div>
                     <div class="line">Stolen by my daughter! Justice! find the girl;</div>
                     <div class="line">She hath the stones upon her, and the ducats.'</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SALARINO</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, all the boys in Venice follow him,</div>
                     <div class="line">Crying, his stones, his daughter, and his ducats.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SALANIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Let good Antonio look he keep his day,</div>
                     <div class="line">Or he shall pay for this.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SALARINO</div>
                     <div class="line">Marry, well remember'd.</div>
                     <div class="line">I reason'd with a Frenchman yesterday,</div>
                     <div class="line">Who told me, in the narrow seas that part</div>
                     <div class="line">The French and English, there miscarried</div>
                     <div class="line">A vessel of our country richly fraught:</div>
                     <div class="line">I thought upon Antonio when he told me;</div>
                     <div class="line">And wish'd in silence that it were not his.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SALANIO</div>
                     <div class="line">You were best to tell Antonio what you hear;</div>
                     <div class="line">Yet do not suddenly, for it may grieve him.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SALARINO</div>
                     <div class="line">A kinder gentleman treads not the earth.</div>
                     <div class="line">I saw Bassanio and Antonio part:</div>
                     <div class="line">Bassanio told him he would make some speed</div>
                     <div class="line">Of his return: he answer'd, 'Do not so;</div>
                     <div class="line">Slubber not business for my sake, Bassanio</div>
                     <div class="line">But stay the very riping of the time;</div>
                     <div class="line">And for the Jew's bond which he hath of me,</div>
                     <div class="line">Let it not enter in your mind of love:</div>
                     <div class="line">Be merry, and employ your chiefest thoughts</div>
                     <div class="line">To courtship and such fair ostents of love</div>
                     <div class="line">As shall conveniently become you there:'</div>
                     <div class="line">And even there, his eye being big with tears,</div>
                     <div class="line">Turning his face, he put his hand behind him,</div>
                     <div class="line">And with affection wondrous sensible</div>
                     <div class="line">He wrung Bassanio's hand; and so they parted.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SALANIO</div>
                     <div class="line">I think he only loves the world for him.</div>
                     <div class="line">I pray thee, let us go and find him out</div>
                     <div class="line">And quicken his embraced heaviness</div>
                     <div class="line">With some delight or other.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">SALARINO</div>
                     <div class="line">Do we so.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.4.10">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>9. SCENE IX.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter NERISSA with a Servitor</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">NERISSA</div>
                     <div class="line">Quick, quick, I pray thee; draw the curtain straight:</div>
                     <div class="line">The Prince of Arragon hath ta'en his oath,</div>
                     <div class="line">And comes to his election presently.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Flourish of cornets. Enter the PRINCE OF ARRAGON,
PORTIA, and their trains</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PORTIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Behold, there stand the caskets, noble prince:</div>
                     <div class="line">If you choose that wherein I am contain'd,</div>
                     <div class="line">Straight shall our nuptial rites be solemnized:</div>
                     <div class="line">But if you fail, without more speech, my lord,</div>
                     <div class="line">You must be gone from hence immediately.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ARRAGON</div>
                     <div class="line">I am enjoin'd by oath to observe three things:</div>
                     <div class="line">First, never to unfold to any one</div>
                     <div class="line">Which casket 'twas I chose; next, if I fail</div>
                     <div class="line">Of the right casket, never in my life</div>
                     <div class="line">To woo a maid in way of marriage: Lastly,</div>
                     <div class="line">If I do fail in fortune of my choice,</div>
                     <div class="line">Immediately to leave you and be gone.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PORTIA</div>
                     <div class="line">To these injunctions every one doth swear</div>
                     <div class="line">That comes to hazard for my worthless self.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ARRAGON</div>
                     <div class="line">And so have I address'd me. Fortune now</div>
                     <div class="line">To my heart's hope! Gold; silver; and base lead.</div>
                     <div class="line">'Who chooseth me must give and hazard all he hath.'</div>
                     <div class="line">You shall look fairer, ere I give or hazard.</div>
                     <div class="line">What says the golden chest? ha! let me see:</div>
                     <div class="line">'Who chooseth me shall gain what many men desire.'</div>
                     <div class="line">What many men desire! that 'many' may be meant</div>
                     <div class="line">By the fool multitude, that choose by show,</div>
                     <div class="line">Not learning more than the fond eye doth teach;</div>
                     <div class="line">Which pries not to the interior, but, like the martlet,</div>
                     <div class="line">Builds in the weather on the outward wall,</div>
                     <div class="line">Even in the force and road of casualty.</div>
                     <div class="line">I will not choose what many men desire,</div>
                     <div class="line">Because I will not jump with common spirits</div>
                     <div class="line">And rank me with the barbarous multitudes.</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, then to thee, thou silver treasure-house;</div>
                     <div class="line">Tell me once more what title thou dost bear:</div>
                     <div class="line">'Who chooseth me shall get as much as he deserves:'</div>
                     <div class="line">And well said too; for who shall go about</div>
                     <div class="line">To cozen fortune and be honourable</div>
                     <div class="line">Without the stamp of merit? Let none presume</div>
                     <div class="line">To wear an undeserved dignity.</div>
                     <div class="line">O, that estates, degrees and offices</div>
                     <div class="line">Were not derived corruptly, and that clear honour</div>
                     <div class="line">Were purchased by the merit of the wearer!</div>
                     <div class="line">How many then should cover that stand bare!</div>
                     <div class="line">How many be commanded that command!</div>
                     <div class="line">How much low peasantry would then be glean'd</div>
                     <div class="line">From the true seed of honour! and how much honour</div>
                     <div class="line">Pick'd from the chaff and ruin of the times</div>
                     <div class="line">To be new-varnish'd! Well, but to my choice:</div>
                     <div class="line">'Who chooseth me shall get as much as he deserves.'</div>
                     <div class="line">I will assume desert. Give me a key for this,</div>
                     <div class="line">And instantly unlock my fortunes here.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>He opens the silver casket</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PORTIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Too long a pause for that which you find there.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ARRAGON</div>
                     <div class="line">What's here? the portrait of a blinking idiot,</div>
                     <div class="line">Presenting me a schedule! I will read it.</div>
                     <div class="line">How much unlike art thou to Portia!</div>
                     <div class="line">How much unlike my hopes and my deservings!</div>
                     <div class="line">'Who chooseth me shall have as much as he deserves.'</div>
                     <div class="line">Did I deserve no more than a fool's head?</div>
                     <div class="line">Is that my prize? are my deserts no better?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PORTIA</div>
                     <div class="line">To offend, and judge, are distinct offices</div>
                     <div class="line">And of opposed natures.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ARRAGON</div>
                     <div class="line">What is here?</div>
                     <p>Reads</p>
                     <div class="line">The fire seven times tried this:</div>
                     <div class="line">Seven times tried that judgment is,</div>
                     <div class="line">That did never choose amiss.</div>
                     <div class="line">Some there be that shadows kiss;</div>
                     <div class="line">Such have but a shadow's bliss:</div>
                     <div class="line">There be fools alive, I wis,</div>
                     <div class="line">Silver'd o'er; and so was this.</div>
                     <div class="line">Take what wife you will to bed,</div>
                     <div class="line">I will ever be your head:</div>
                     <div class="line">So be gone: you are sped.</div>
                     <div class="line">Still more fool I shall appear</div>
                     <div class="line">By the time I linger here</div>
                     <div class="line">With one fool's head I came to woo,</div>
                     <div class="line">But I go away with two.</div>
                     <div class="line">Sweet, adieu. I'll keep my oath,</div>
                     <div class="line">Patiently to bear my wroth.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt Arragon and train</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PORTIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Thus hath the candle singed the moth.</div>
                     <div class="line">O, these deliberate fools! when they do choose,</div>
                     <div class="line">They have the wisdom by their wit to lose.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
