                     <b>Table of Contents</b>
                  </p>
                  <ul class="toc">
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.7.2">1. SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                  </ul>
               </div>
            </div>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.7.2">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>1. SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter LORENZO and JESSICA</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LORENZO</div>
                     <div class="line">The moon shines bright: in such a night as this,</div>
                     <div class="line">When the sweet wind did gently kiss the trees</div>
                     <div class="line">And they did make no noise, in such a night</div>
                     <div class="line">Troilus methinks mounted the Troyan walls</div>
                     <div class="line">And sigh'd his soul toward the Grecian tents,</div>
                     <div class="line">Where Cressid lay that night.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JESSICA</div>
                     <div class="line">In such a night</div>
                     <div class="line">Did Thisbe fearfully o'ertrip the dew</div>
                     <div class="line">And saw the lion's shadow ere himself</div>
                     <div class="line">And ran dismay'd away.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LORENZO</div>
                     <div class="line">In such a night</div>
                     <div class="line">Stood Dido with a willow in her hand</div>
                     <div class="line">Upon the wild sea banks and waft her love</div>
                     <div class="line">To come again to Carthage.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JESSICA</div>
                     <div class="line">In such a night</div>
                     <div class="line">Medea gather'd the enchanted herbs</div>
                     <div class="line">That did renew old AEson.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LORENZO</div>
                     <div class="line">In such a night</div>
                     <div class="line">Did Jessica steal from the wealthy Jew</div>
                     <div class="line">And with an unthrift love did run from Venice</div>
                     <div class="line">As far as Belmont.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JESSICA</div>
                     <div class="line">In such a night</div>
                     <div class="line">Did young Lorenzo swear he loved her well,</div>
                     <div class="line">Stealing her soul with many vows of faith</div>
                     <div class="line">And ne'er a true one.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LORENZO</div>
                     <div class="line">In such a night</div>
                     <div class="line">Did pretty Jessica, like a little shrew,</div>
                     <div class="line">Slander her love, and he forgave it her.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JESSICA</div>
                     <div class="line">I would out-night you, did no body come;</div>
                     <div class="line">But, hark, I hear the footing of a man.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter STEPHANO</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LORENZO</div>
                     <div class="line">Who comes so fast in silence of the night?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">STEPHANO</div>
                     <div class="line">A friend.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LORENZO</div>
                     <div class="line">A friend! what friend? your name, I pray you, friend?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">STEPHANO</div>
                     <div class="line">Stephano is my name; and I bring word</div>
                     <div class="line">My mistress will before the break of day</div>
                     <div class="line">Be here at Belmont; she doth stray about</div>
                     <div class="line">By holy crosses, where she kneels and prays</div>
                     <div class="line">For happy wedlock hours.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LORENZO</div>
                     <div class="line">Who comes with her?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">STEPHANO</div>
                     <div class="line">None but a holy hermit and her maid.</div>
                     <div class="line">I pray you, is my master yet return'd?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LORENZO</div>
                     <div class="line">He is not, nor we have not heard from him.</div>
                     <div class="line">But go we in, I pray thee, Jessica,</div>
                     <div class="line">And ceremoniously let us prepare</div>
                     <div class="line">Some welcome for the mistress of the house.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter LAUNCELOT</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAUNCELOT</div>
                     <div class="line">Sola, sola! wo ha, ho! sola, sola!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LORENZO</div>
                     <div class="line">Who calls?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAUNCELOT</div>
                     <div class="line">Sola! did you see Master Lorenzo?</div>
                     <div class="line">Master Lorenzo, sola, sola!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LORENZO</div>
                     <div class="line">Leave hollaing, man: here.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAUNCELOT</div>
                     <div class="line">Sola! where? where?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LORENZO</div>
                     <div class="line">Here.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LAUNCELOT</div>
                     <div class="line">Tell him there's a post come from my master, with</div>
                     <div class="line">his horn full of good news: my master will be here</div>
                     <div class="line">ere morning.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LORENZO</div>
                     <div class="line">Sweet soul, let's in, and there expect their coming.</div>
                     <div class="line">And yet no matter: why should we go in?</div>
                     <div class="line">My friend Stephano, signify, I pray you,</div>
                     <div class="line">Within the house, your mistress is at hand;</div>
                     <div class="line">And bring your music forth into the air.</div>
                     <p>Exit Stephano</p>
                     <div class="line">How sweet the moonlight sleeps upon this bank!</div>
                     <div class="line">Here will we sit and let the sounds of music</div>
                     <div class="line">Creep in our ears: soft stillness and the night</div>
                     <div class="line">Become the touches of sweet harmony.</div>
                     <div class="line">Sit, Jessica. Look how the floor of heaven</div>
                     <div class="line">Is thick inlaid with patines of bright gold:</div>
                     <div class="line">There's not the smallest orb which thou behold'st</div>
                     <div class="line">But in his motion like an angel sings,</div>
                     <div class="line">Still quiring to the young-eyed cherubins;</div>
                     <div class="line">Such harmony is in immortal souls;</div>
                     <div class="line">But whilst this muddy vesture of decay</div>
                     <div class="line">Doth grossly close it in, we cannot hear it.</div>
                     <p>Enter Musicians</p>
                     <div class="line">Come, ho! and wake Diana with a hymn!</div>
                     <div class="line">With sweetest touches pierce your mistress' ear,</div>
                     <div class="line">And draw her home with music.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Music</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">JESSICA</div>
                     <div class="line">I am never merry when I hear sweet music.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LORENZO</div>
                     <div class="line">The reason is, your spirits are attentive:</div>
                     <div class="line">For do but note a wild and wanton herd,</div>
                     <div class="line">Or race of youthful and unhandled colts,</div>
                     <div class="line">Fetching mad bounds, bellowing and neighing loud,</div>
                     <div class="line">Which is the hot condition of their blood;</div>
                     <div class="line">If they but hear perchance a trumpet sound,</div>
                     <div class="line">Or any air of music touch their ears,</div>
                     <div class="line">You shall perceive them make a mutual stand,</div>
                     <div class="line">Their savage eyes turn'd to a modest gaze</div>
                     <div class="line">By the sweet power of music: therefore the poet</div>
                     <div class="line">Did feign that Orpheus drew trees, stones and floods;</div>
                     <div class="line">Since nought so stockish, hard and full of rage,</div>
                     <div class="line">But music for the time doth change his nature.</div>
                     <div class="line">The man that hath no music in himself,</div>
                     <div class="line">Nor is not moved with concord of sweet sounds,</div>
                     <div class="line">Is fit for treasons, stratagems and spoils;</div>
                     <div class="line">The motions of his spirit are dull as night</div>
                     <div class="line">And his affections dark as Erebus:</div>
                     <div class="line">Let no such man be trusted. Mark the music.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter PORTIA and NERISSA</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PORTIA</div>
                     <div class="line">That light we see is burning in my hall.</div>
                     <div class="line">How far that little candle throws his beams!</div>
                     <div class="line">So shines a good deed in a naughty world.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">NERISSA</div>
                     <div class="line">When the moon shone, we did not see the candle.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PORTIA</div>
                     <div class="line">So doth the greater glory dim the less:</div>
                     <div class="line">A substitute shines brightly as a king</div>
                     <div class="line">Unto the king be by, and then his state</div>
                     <div class="line">Empties itself, as doth an inland brook</div>
                     <div class="line">Into the main of waters. Music! hark!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">NERISSA</div>
                     <div class="line">It is your music, madam, of the house.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PORTIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Nothing is good, I see, without respect:</div>
                     <div class="line">Methinks it sounds much sweeter than by day.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">NERISSA</div>
                     <div class="line">Silence bestows that virtue on it, madam.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PORTIA</div>
                     <div class="line">The crow doth sing as sweetly as the lark,</div>
                     <div class="line">When neither is attended, and I think</div>
                     <div class="line">The nightingale, if she should sing by day,</div>
                     <div class="line">When every goose is cackling, would be thought</div>
                     <div class="line">No better a musician than the wren.</div>
                     <div class="line">How many things by season season'd are</div>
                     <div class="line">To their right praise and true perfection!</div>
                     <div class="line">Peace, ho! the moon sleeps with Endymion</div>
                     <div class="line">And would not be awaked.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Music ceases</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LORENZO</div>
                     <div class="line">That is the voice,</div>
                     <div class="line">Or I am much deceived, of Portia.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PORTIA</div>
                     <div class="line">He knows me as the blind man knows the cuckoo,</div>
                     <div class="line">By the bad voice.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LORENZO</div>
                     <div class="line">Dear lady, welcome home.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PORTIA</div>
                     <div class="line">We have been praying for our husbands' healths,</div>
                     <div class="line">Which speed, we hope, the better for our words.</div>
                     <div class="line">Are they return'd?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LORENZO</div>
                     <div class="line">Madam, they are not yet;</div>
                     <div class="line">But there is come a messenger before,</div>
                     <div class="line">To signify their coming.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PORTIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Go in, Nerissa;</div>
                     <div class="line">Give order to my servants that they take</div>
                     <div class="line">No note at all of our being absent hence;</div>
                     <div class="line">Nor you, Lorenzo; Jessica, nor you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>A tucket sounds</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LORENZO</div>
                     <div class="line">Your husband is at hand; I hear his trumpet:</div>
                     <div class="line">We are no tell-tales, madam; fear you not.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PORTIA</div>
                     <div class="line">This night methinks is but the daylight sick;</div>
                     <div class="line">It looks a little paler: 'tis a day,</div>
                     <div class="line">Such as the day is when the sun is hid.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter BASSANIO, ANTONIO, GRATIANO, and
their followers</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BASSANIO</div>
                     <div class="line">We should hold day with the Antipodes,</div>
                     <div class="line">If you would walk in absence of the sun.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PORTIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Let me give light, but let me not be light;</div>
                     <div class="line">For a light wife doth make a heavy husband,</div>
                     <div class="line">And never be Bassanio so for me:</div>
                     <div class="line">But God sort all! You are welcome home, my lord.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BASSANIO</div>
                     <div class="line">I thank you, madam. Give welcome to my friend.</div>
                     <div class="line">This is the man, this is Antonio,</div>
                     <div class="line">To whom I am so infinitely bound.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PORTIA</div>
                     <div class="line">You should in all sense be much bound to him.</div>
                     <div class="line">For, as I hear, he was much bound for you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ANTONIO</div>
                     <div class="line">No more than I am well acquitted of.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PORTIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Sir, you are very welcome to our house:</div>
                     <div class="line">It must appear in other ways than words,</div>
                     <div class="line">Therefore I scant this breathing courtesy.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GRATIANO</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>To NERISSA</span>  By yonder moon I swear you do me wrong;</div>
                     <div class="line">In faith, I gave it to the judge's clerk:</div>
                     <div class="line">Would he were gelt that had it, for my part,</div>
                     <div class="line">Since you do take it, love, so much at heart.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PORTIA</div>
                     <div class="line">A quarrel, ho, already! what's the matter?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GRATIANO</div>
                     <div class="line">About a hoop of gold, a paltry ring</div>
                     <div class="line">That she did give me, whose posy was</div>
                     <div class="line">For all the world like cutler's poetry</div>
                     <div class="line">Upon a knife, 'Love me, and leave me not.'</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">NERISSA</div>
                     <div class="line">What talk you of the posy or the value?</div>
                     <div class="line">You swore to me, when I did give it you,</div>
                     <div class="line">That you would wear it till your hour of death</div>
                     <div class="line">And that it should lie with you in your grave:</div>
                     <div class="line">Though not for me, yet for your vehement oaths,</div>
                     <div class="line">You should have been respective and have kept it.</div>
                     <div class="line">Gave it a judge's clerk! no, God's my judge,</div>
                     <div class="line">The clerk will ne'er wear hair on's face that had it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GRATIANO</div>
                     <div class="line">He will, an if he live to be a man.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">NERISSA</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, if a woman live to be a man.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GRATIANO</div>
                     <div class="line">Now, by this hand, I gave it to a youth,</div>
                     <div class="line">A kind of boy, a little scrubbed boy,</div>
                     <div class="line">No higher than thyself; the judge's clerk,</div>
                     <div class="line">A prating boy, that begg'd it as a fee:</div>
                     <div class="line">I could not for my heart deny it him.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PORTIA</div>
                     <div class="line">You were to blame, I must be plain with you,</div>
                     <div class="line">To part so slightly with your wife's first gift:</div>
                     <div class="line">A thing stuck on with oaths upon your finger</div>
                     <div class="line">And so riveted with faith unto your flesh.</div>
                     <div class="line">I gave my love a ring and made him swear</div>
                     <div class="line">Never to part with it; and here he stands;</div>
                     <div class="line">I dare be sworn for him he would not leave it</div>
                     <div class="line">Nor pluck it from his finger, for the wealth</div>
                     <div class="line">That the world masters. Now, in faith, Gratiano,</div>
                     <div class="line">You give your wife too unkind a cause of grief:</div>
                     <div class="line">An 'twere to me, I should be mad at it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BASSANIO</div>
                     <div class="line">
                        <span>Aside</span>  Why, I were best to cut my left hand off</div>
                     <div class="line">And swear I lost the ring defending it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GRATIANO</div>
                     <div class="line">My Lord Bassanio gave his ring away</div>
                     <div class="line">Unto the judge that begg'd it and indeed</div>
                     <div class="line">Deserved it too; and then the boy, his clerk,</div>
                     <div class="line">That took some pains in writing, he begg'd mine;</div>
                     <div class="line">And neither man nor master would take aught</div>
                     <div class="line">But the two rings.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PORTIA</div>
                     <div class="line">What ring gave you my lord?</div>
                     <div class="line">Not that, I hope, which you received of me.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BASSANIO</div>
                     <div class="line">If I could add a lie unto a fault,</div>
                     <div class="line">I would deny it; but you see my finger</div>
                     <div class="line">Hath not the ring upon it; it is gone.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PORTIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Even so void is your false heart of truth.</div>
                     <div class="line">By heaven, I will ne'er come in your bed</div>
                     <div class="line">Until I see the ring.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">NERISSA</div>
                     <div class="line">Nor I in yours</div>
                     <div class="line">Till I again see mine.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BASSANIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Sweet Portia,</div>
                     <div class="line">If you did know to whom I gave the ring,</div>
                     <div class="line">If you did know for whom I gave the ring</div>
                     <div class="line">And would conceive for what I gave the ring</div>
                     <div class="line">And how unwillingly I left the ring,</div>
                     <div class="line">When nought would be accepted but the ring,</div>
                     <div class="line">You would abate the strength of your displeasure.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PORTIA</div>
                     <div class="line">If you had known the virtue of the ring,</div>
                     <div class="line">Or half her worthiness that gave the ring,</div>
                     <div class="line">Or your own honour to contain the ring,</div>
                     <div class="line">You would not then have parted with the ring.</div>
                     <div class="line">What man is there so much unreasonable,</div>
                     <div class="line">If you had pleased to have defended it</div>
                     <div class="line">With any terms of zeal, wanted the modesty</div>
                     <div class="line">To urge the thing held as a ceremony?</div>
                     <div class="line">Nerissa teaches me what to believe:</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll die for't but some woman had the ring.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BASSANIO</div>
                     <div class="line">No, by my honour, madam, by my soul,</div>
                     <div class="line">No woman had it, but a civil doctor,</div>
                     <div class="line">Which did refuse three thousand ducats of me</div>
                     <div class="line">And begg'd the ring; the which I did deny him</div>
                     <div class="line">And suffer'd him to go displeased away;</div>
                     <div class="line">Even he that did uphold the very life</div>
                     <div class="line">Of my dear friend. What should I say, sweet lady?</div>
                     <div class="line">I was enforced to send it after him;</div>
                     <div class="line">I was beset with shame and courtesy;</div>
                     <div class="line">My honour would not let ingratitude</div>
                     <div class="line">So much besmear it. Pardon me, good lady;</div>
                     <div class="line">For, by these blessed candles of the night,</div>
                     <div class="line">Had you been there, I think you would have begg'd</div>
                     <div class="line">The ring of me to give the worthy doctor.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PORTIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Let not that doctor e'er come near my house:</div>
                     <div class="line">Since he hath got the jewel that I loved,</div>
                     <div class="line">And that which you did swear to keep for me,</div>
                     <div class="line">I will become as liberal as you;</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll not deny him any thing I have,</div>
                     <div class="line">No, not my body nor my husband's bed:</div>
                     <div class="line">Know him I shall, I am well sure of it:</div>
                     <div class="line">Lie not a night from home; watch me like Argus:</div>
                     <div class="line">If you do not, if I be left alone,</div>
                     <div class="line">Now, by mine honour, which is yet mine own,</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll have that doctor for my bedfellow.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">NERISSA</div>
                     <div class="line">And I his clerk; therefore be well advised</div>
                     <div class="line">How you do leave me to mine own protection.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GRATIANO</div>
                     <div class="line">Well, do you so; let not me take him, then;</div>
                     <div class="line">For if I do, I'll mar the young clerk's pen.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ANTONIO</div>
                     <div class="line">I am the unhappy subject of these quarrels.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PORTIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Sir, grieve not you; you are welcome notwithstanding.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BASSANIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Portia, forgive me this enforced wrong;</div>
                     <div class="line">And, in the hearing of these many friends,</div>
                     <div class="line">I swear to thee, even by thine own fair eyes,</div>
                     <div class="line">Wherein I see myself--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PORTIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Mark you but that!</div>
                     <div class="line">In both my eyes he doubly sees himself;</div>
                     <div class="line">In each eye, one: swear by your double self,</div>
                     <div class="line">And there's an oath of credit.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BASSANIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, but hear me:</div>
                     <div class="line">Pardon this fault, and by my soul I swear</div>
                     <div class="line">I never more will break an oath with thee.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ANTONIO</div>
                     <div class="line">I once did lend my body for his wealth;</div>
                     <div class="line">Which, but for him that had your husband's ring,</div>
                     <div class="line">Had quite miscarried: I dare be bound again,</div>
                     <div class="line">My soul upon the forfeit, that your lord</div>
                     <div class="line">Will never more break faith advisedly.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PORTIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Then you shall be his surety. Give him this</div>
                     <div class="line">And bid him keep it better than the other.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ANTONIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Here, Lord Bassanio; swear to keep this ring.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BASSANIO</div>
                     <div class="line">By heaven, it is the same I gave the doctor!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PORTIA</div>
                     <div class="line">I had it of him: pardon me, Bassanio;</div>
                     <div class="line">For, by this ring, the doctor lay with me.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">NERISSA</div>
                     <div class="line">And pardon me, my gentle Gratiano;</div>
                     <div class="line">For that same scrubbed boy, the doctor's clerk,</div>
                     <div class="line">In lieu of this last night did lie with me.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GRATIANO</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, this is like the mending of highways</div>
                     <div class="line">In summer, where the ways are fair enough:</div>
                     <div class="line">What, are we cuckolds ere we have deserved it?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PORTIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Speak not so grossly. You are all amazed:</div>
                     <div class="line">Here is a letter; read it at your leisure;</div>
                     <div class="line">It comes from Padua, from Bellario:</div>
                     <div class="line">There you shall find that Portia was the doctor,</div>
                     <div class="line">Nerissa there her clerk: Lorenzo here</div>
                     <div class="line">Shall witness I set forth as soon as you</div>
                     <div class="line">And even but now return'd; I have not yet</div>
                     <div class="line">Enter'd my house. Antonio, you are welcome;</div>
                     <div class="line">And I have better news in store for you</div>
                     <div class="line">Than you expect: unseal this letter soon;</div>
                     <div class="line">There you shall find three of your argosies</div>
                     <div class="line">Are richly come to harbour suddenly:</div>
                     <div class="line">You shall not know by what strange accident</div>
                     <div class="line">I chanced on this letter.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ANTONIO</div>
                     <div class="line">I am dumb.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BASSANIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Were you the doctor and I knew you not?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GRATIANO</div>
                     <div class="line">Were you the clerk that is to make me cuckold?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">NERISSA</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, but the clerk that never means to do it,</div>
                     <div class="line">Unless he live until he be a man.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">BASSANIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Sweet doctor, you shall be my bed-fellow:</div>
                     <div class="line">When I am absent, then lie with my wife.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ANTONIO</div>
                     <div class="line">Sweet lady, you have given me life and living;</div>
                     <div class="line">For here I read for certain that my ships</div>
                     <div class="line">Are safely come to road.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PORTIA</div>
                     <div class="line">How now, Lorenzo!</div>
                     <div class="line">My clerk hath some good comforts too for you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">NERISSA</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, and I'll give them him without a fee.</div>
                     <div class="line">There do I give to you and Jessica,</div>
                     <div class="line">From the rich Jew, a special deed of gift,</div>
                     <div class="line">After his death, of all he dies possess'd of.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LORENZO</div>
                     <div class="line">Fair ladies, you drop manna in the way</div>
                     <div class="line">Of starved people.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">PORTIA</div>
                     <div class="line">It is almost morning,</div>
                     <div class="line">And yet I am sure you are not satisfied</div>
                     <div class="line">Of these events at full. Let us go in;</div>
                     <div class="line">And charge us there upon inter'gatories,</div>
                     <div class="line">And we will answer all things faithfully.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">GRATIANO</div>
                     <div class="line">Let it be so: the first inter'gatory</div>
                     <div class="line">That my Nerissa shall be sworn on is,</div>
                     <div class="line">Whether till the next night she had rather stay,</div>
                     <div class="line">Or go to bed now, being two hours to day:</div>
                     <div class="line">But were the day come, I should wish it dark,</div>
                     <div class="line">That I were couching with the doctor's clerk.</div>
                     <div class="line">Well, while I live I'll fear no other thing</div>
                     <div class="line">So sore as keeping safe Nerissa's ring.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
         </article>
      </article>
      <script src="../../resources/js/prism.js"/>
   </body>
</html>
<html>
   <head>
      <link href="../../resources/css/db-prism.css" rel="stylesheet" type="text/css"/>
      <link href="../../resources/css/default.css" rel="stylesheet" type="text/css"/>
      <link href="../../resources/css/prism.css" rel="stylesheet" type="text/css"/>
      <link href="../../resources/css/publishers.css" rel="stylesheet" type="text/css"/>
      <meta charset="utf-8"/>
      <meta content="DocBook XSL 2.0 Stylesheets Vxxx" name="generator"/>
      <script src="../../resources/js/dbmodnizr.js" type="text/javascript"/>
      <title>The Merchant of Venice</title>
   </head>
   <body>
      <article class="book" id="R.1">
         <header class="book-titlepage">
            <h1>The Merchant of Venice</h1>
         </header>

         <div class="content">
            <article class="preface" id="R.1.2">
               <header class="preface-titlepage">
                  <h2>Dramatis Personae</h2>
               </header>
               <div class="content">
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">The DUKE OF VENICE. </span>
                  </p>
                  <table border="0" class="simplelist" summary="Simple list">
                     <tr>
                        <td>
                           <span class="member">
                              <span class="personname">The PRINCE OF MOROCCO</span>
                              <span class="personname">The PRINCE OF ARRAGON</span>
                           </span>
                        </td>
                        <td>
                           <span class="member">suitors to Portia.</span>
                        </td>
                     </tr>
                  </table>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">ANTONIO, a merchant of Venice.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">BASSANIO, his friend, suitor likewise to Portia.</span>
                  </p>
                  <table border="0" class="simplelist" summary="Simple list">
                     <tr>
                        <td>
                           <span class="member">
                              <span class="personname">SALANIO</span>
                              <span class="personname">SALARINO</span>
                              <span class="personname">GRATIANO</span>
                              <span class="personname">SALERIO</span>
                           </span>
                        </td>
                        <td>
                           <span class="member">friends to Antonio and Bassanio.</span>
                        </td>
                     </tr>
                  </table>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">LORENZO, in love with Jessica.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">SHYLOCK, a rich Jew.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">TUBAL, a Jew, his friend.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">LAUNCELOT GOBBO, the clown, servant to SHYLOCK. </span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">OLD GOBBO, father to Launcelot. </span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">LEONARDO, servant to BASSANIO.</span>
                  </p>
                  <table border="0" class="simplelist" summary="Simple list">
                     <tr>
                        <td>
                           <span class="member">
                              <span class="personname">BALTHASAR</span>
                              <span class="personname">STEPHANO</span>
                           </span>
                        </td>
                        <td>
                           <span class="member">servants to PORTIA.</span>
                        </td>
                     </tr>
                  </table>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">PORTIA, a rich heiress.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">NERISSA, her waiting-maid.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">JESSICA, daughter to SHYLOCK.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">Magnificoes of Venice, Officers of the Court of Justice, Gaoler, Servants to Portia, and other Attendants.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>SCENE  Partly at Venice, and partly at Belmont, the seat of PORTIA, on the Continent.</p>
               </div>
            </article>
            <article class="chapter" id="R.1.3">
               <header class="chapter-titlepage">
                  <h2>Chapter 1. ACT I</h2>
               </header>
               <div class="lists-of-titles">
                  <div class="toc">
                     <p>
                        <b>Table of Contents</b>
                     </p>
                     <ul class="toc">
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.3.2">1. SCENE I.  Venice. A street.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.3.3">2. SCENE II: Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.3.4">3. SCENE III.  Venice. A public place.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                     </ul>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="content">
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.3.2">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>1. SCENE I.  Venice. A street.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Enter ANTONIO, SALARINO, and SALANIO</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ANTONIO</div>
                              <div class="line">In sooth, I know not why I am so sad:</div>
                              <div class="line">It wearies me; you say it wearies you;</div>
                              <div class="line">But how I caught it, found it, or came by it,</div>
                              <div class="line">What stuff 'tis made of, whereof it is born,</div>
                              <div class="line">I am to learn;</div>
                              <div class="line">And such a want-wit sadness makes of me,</div>
                              <div class="line">That I have much ado to know myself.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SALARINO</div>
                              <div class="line">Your mind is tossing on the ocean;</div>
                              <div class="line">There, where your argosies with portly sail,</div>
                              <div class="line">Like signiors and rich burghers on the flood,</div>
                              <div class="line">Or, as it were, the pageants of the sea,</div>
                              <div class="line">Do overpeer the petty traffickers,</div>
                              <div class="line">That curtsy to them, do them reverence,</div>
                              <div class="line">As they fly by them with their woven wings.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SALANIO</div>
                              <div class="line">Believe me, sir, had I such venture forth,</div>
                              <div class="line">The better part of my affections would</div>
                              <div class="line">Be with my hopes abroad. I should be still</div>
                              <div class="line">Plucking the grass, to know where sits the wind,</div>
                              <div class="line">Peering in maps for ports and piers and roads;</div>
                              <div class="line">And every object that might make me fear</div>
                              <div class="line">Misfortune to my ventures, out of doubt</div>
                              <div class="line">Would make me sad.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SALARINO</div>
                              <div class="line">My wind cooling my broth</div>
                              <div class="line">Would blow me to an ague, when I thought</div>
                              <div class="line">What harm a wind too great at sea might do.</div>
                              <div class="line">I should not see the sandy hour-glass run,</div>
                              <div class="line">But I should think of shallows and of flats,</div>
                              <div class="line">And see my wealthy Andrew dock'd in sand,</div>
                              <div class="line">Vailing her high-top lower than her ribs</div>
                              <div class="line">To kiss her burial. Should I go to church</div>
                              <div class="line">And see the holy edifice of stone,</div>
                              <div class="line">And not bethink me straight of dangerous rocks,</div>
                              <div class="line">Which touching but my gentle vessel's side,</div>
                              <div class="line">Would scatter all her spices on the stream,</div>
                              <div class="line">Enrobe the roaring waters with my silks,</div>
                              <div class="line">And, in a word, but even now worth this,</div>
                              <div class="line">And now worth nothing? Shall I have the thought</div>
                              <div class="line">To think on this, and shall I lack the thought</div>
                              <div class="line">That such a thing bechanced would make me sad?</div>
                              <div class="line">But tell not me; I know, Antonio</div>
                              <div class="line">Is sad to think upon his merchandise.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ANTONIO</div>
                              <div class="line">Believe me, no: I thank my fortune for it,</div>
                              <div class="line">My ventures are not in one bottom trusted,</div>
                              <div class="line">Nor to one place; nor is my whole estate</div>
                              <div class="line">Upon the fortune of this present year:</div>
                              <div class="line">Therefore my merchandise makes me not sad.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SALARINO</div>
                              <div class="line">Why, then you are in love.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ANTONIO</div>
                              <div class="line">Fie, fie!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SALARINO</div>
                              <div class="line">Not in love neither? Then let us say you are sad,</div>
                              <div class="line">Because you are not merry: and 'twere as easy</div>
                              <div class="line">For you to laugh and leap and say you are merry,</div>
                              <div class="line">Because you are not sad. Now, by two-headed Janus,</div>
                              <div class="line">Nature hath framed strange fellows in her time:</div>
                              <div class="line">Some that will evermore peep through their eyes</div>
                              <div class="line">And laugh like parrots at a bag-piper,</div>
                              <div class="line">And other of such vinegar aspect</div>
                              <div class="line">That they'll not show their teeth in way of smile,</div>
                              <div class="line">Though Nestor swear the jest be laughable.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter BASSANIO, LORENZO, and GRATIANO</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SALANIO</div>
                              <div class="line">Here comes Bassanio, your most noble kinsman,</div>
                              <div class="line">Gratiano and Lorenzo. Fare ye well:</div>
                              <div class="line">We leave you now with better company.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SALARINO</div>
                              <div class="line">I would have stay'd till I had made you merry,</div>
                              <div class="line">If worthier friends had not prevented me.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ANTONIO</div>
                              <div class="line">Your worth is very dear in my regard.</div>
                              <div class="line">I take it, your own business calls on you</div>
                              <div class="line">And you embrace the occasion to depart.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SALARINO</div>
                              <div class="line">Good morrow, my good lords.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BASSANIO</div>
                              <div class="line">Good signiors both, when shall we laugh? say, when?</div>
                              <div class="line">You grow exceeding strange: must it be so?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SALARINO</div>
                              <div class="line">We'll make our leisures to attend on yours.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt Salarino and Salanio</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LORENZO</div>
                              <div class="line">My Lord Bassanio, since you have found Antonio,</div>
                              <div class="line">We two will leave you: but at dinner-time,</div>
                              <div class="line">I pray you, have in mind where we must meet.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BASSANIO</div>
                              <div class="line">I will not fail you.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GRATIANO</div>
                              <div class="line">You look not well, Signior Antonio;</div>
                              <div class="line">You have too much respect upon the world:</div>
                              <div class="line">They lose it that do buy it with much care:</div>
                              <div class="line">Believe me, you are marvellously changed.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ANTONIO</div>
                              <div class="line">I hold the world but as the world, Gratiano;</div>
                              <div class="line">A stage where every man must play a part,</div>
                              <div class="line">And mine a sad one.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GRATIANO</div>
                              <div class="line">Let me play the fool:</div>
                              <div class="line">With mirth and laughter let old wrinkles come,</div>
                              <div class="line">And let my liver rather heat with wine</div>
                              <div class="line">Than my heart cool with mortifying groans.</div>
                              <div class="line">Why should a man, whose blood is warm within,</div>
                              <div class="line">Sit like his grandsire cut in alabaster?</div>
                              <div class="line">Sleep when he wakes and creep into the jaundice</div>
                              <div class="line">By being peevish? I tell thee what, Antonio--</div>
                              <div class="line">I love thee, and it is my love that speaks--</div>
                              <div class="line">There are a sort of men whose visages</div>
                              <div class="line">Do cream and mantle like a standing pond,</div>
                              <div class="line">And do a wilful stillness entertain,</div>
                              <div class="line">With purpose to be dress'd in an opinion</div>
                              <div class="line">Of wisdom, gravity, profound conceit,</div>
                              <div class="line">As who should say 'I am Sir Oracle,</div>
                              <div class="line">And when I ope my lips let no dog bark!'</div>
                              <div class="line">O my Antonio, I do know of these</div>
                              <div class="line">That therefore only are reputed wise</div>
                              <div class="line">For saying nothing; when, I am very sure,</div>
                              <div class="line">If they should speak, would almost damn those ears,</div>
                              <div class="line">Which, hearing them, would call their brothers fools.</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll tell thee more of this another time:</div>
                              <div class="line">But fish not, with this melancholy bait,</div>
                              <div class="line">For this fool gudgeon, this opinion.</div>
                              <div class="line">Come, good Lorenzo. Fare ye well awhile:</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll end my exhortation after dinner.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LORENZO</div>
                              <div class="line">Well, we will leave you then till dinner-time:</div>
                              <div class="line">I must be one of these same dumb wise men,</div>
                              <div class="line">For Gratiano never lets me speak.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GRATIANO</div>
                              <div class="line">Well, keep me company but two years moe,</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou shalt not know the sound of thine own tongue.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ANTONIO</div>
                              <div class="line">Farewell: I'll grow a talker for this gear.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GRATIANO</div>
                              <div class="line">Thanks, i' faith, for silence is only commendable</div>
                              <div class="line">In a neat's tongue dried and a maid not vendible.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt GRATIANO and LORENZO</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ANTONIO</div>
                              <div class="line">Is that any thing now?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BASSANIO</div>
                              <div class="line">Gratiano speaks an infinite deal of nothing, more</div>
                              <div class="line">than any man in all Venice. His reasons are as two</div>
                              <div class="line">grains of wheat hid in two bushels of chaff: you</div>
                              <div class="line">shall seek all day ere you find them, and when you</div>
                              <div class="line">have them, they are not worth the search.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ANTONIO</div>
                              <div class="line">Well, tell me now what lady is the same</div>
                              <div class="line">To whom you swore a secret pilgrimage,</div>
                              <div class="line">That you to-day promised to tell me of?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BASSANIO</div>
                              <div class="line">'Tis not unknown to you, Antonio,</div>
                              <div class="line">How much I have disabled mine estate,</div>
                              <div class="line">By something showing a more swelling port</div>
                              <div class="line">Than my faint means would grant continuance:</div>
                              <div class="line">Nor do I now make moan to be abridged</div>
                              <div class="line">From such a noble rate; but my chief care</div>
                              <div class="line">Is to come fairly off from the great debts</div>
                              <div class="line">Wherein my time something too prodigal</div>
                              <div class="line">Hath left me gaged. To you, Antonio,</div>
                              <div class="line">I owe the most, in money and in love,</div>
                              <div class="line">And from your love I have a warranty</div>
                              <div class="line">To unburden all my plots and purposes</div>
                              <div class="line">How to get clear of all the debts I owe.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ANTONIO</div>
                              <div class="line">I pray you, good Bassanio, let me know it;</div>
                              <div class="line">And if it stand, as you yourself still do,</div>
                              <div class="line">Within the eye of honour, be assured,</div>
                              <div class="line">My purse, my person, my extremest means,</div>
                              <div class="line">Lie all unlock'd to your occasions.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BASSANIO</div>
                              <div class="line">In my school-days, when I had lost one shaft,</div>
                              <div class="line">I shot his fellow of the self-same flight</div>
                              <div class="line">The self-same way with more advised watch,</div>
                              <div class="line">To find the other forth, and by adventuring both</div>
                              <div class="line">I oft found both: I urge this childhood proof,</div>
                              <div class="line">Because what follows is pure innocence.</div>
                              <div class="line">I owe you much, and, like a wilful youth,</div>
                              <div class="line">That which I owe is lost; but if you please</div>
                              <div class="line">To shoot another arrow that self way</div>
                              <div class="line">Which you did shoot the first, I do not doubt,</div>
                              <div class="line">As I will watch the aim, or to find both</div>
                              <div class="line">Or bring your latter hazard back again</div>
                              <div class="line">And thankfully rest debtor for the first.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ANTONIO</div>
                              <div class="line">You know me well, and herein spend but time</div>
                              <div class="line">To wind about my love with circumstance;</div>
                              <div class="line">And out of doubt you do me now more wrong</div>
                              <div class="line">In making question of my uttermost</div>
                              <div class="line">Than if you had made waste of all I have:</div>
                              <div class="line">Then do but say to me what I should do</div>
                              <div class="line">That in your knowledge may by me be done,</div>
                              <div class="line">And I am prest unto it: therefore, speak.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BASSANIO</div>
                              <div class="line">In Belmont is a lady richly left;</div>
                              <div class="line">And she is fair, and, fairer than that word,</div>
                              <div class="line">Of wondrous virtues: sometimes from her eyes</div>
                              <div class="line">I did receive fair speechless messages:</div>
                              <div class="line">Her name is Portia, nothing undervalued</div>
                              <div class="line">To Cato's daughter, Brutus' Portia:</div>
                              <div class="line">Nor is the wide world ignorant of her worth,</div>
                              <div class="line">For the four winds blow in from every coast</div>
                              <div class="line">Renowned suitors, and her sunny locks</div>
                              <div class="line">Hang on her temples like a golden fleece;</div>
                              <div class="line">Which makes her seat of Belmont Colchos' strand,</div>
                              <div class="line">And many Jasons come in quest of her.</div>
                              <div class="line">O my Antonio, had I but the means</div>
                              <div class="line">To hold a rival place with one of them,</div>
                              <div class="line">I have a mind presages me such thrift,</div>
                              <div class="line">That I should questionless be fortunate!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ANTONIO</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou know'st that all my fortunes are at sea;</div>
                              <div class="line">Neither have I money nor commodity</div>
                              <div class="line">To raise a present sum: therefore go forth;</div>
                              <div class="line">Try what my credit can in Venice do:</div>
                              <div class="line">That shall be rack'd, even to the uttermost,</div>
                              <div class="line">To furnish thee to Belmont, to fair Portia.</div>
                              <div class="line">Go, presently inquire, and so will I,</div>
                              <div class="line">Where money is, and I no question make</div>
                              <div class="line">To have it of my trust or for my sake.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt</p>
                     </div>
                  </section>
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.3.3">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>2. SCENE II: Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Enter PORTIA and NERISSA</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PORTIA</div>
                              <div class="line">By my troth, Nerissa, my little body is aweary of</div>
                              <div class="line">this great world.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">NERISSA</div>
                              <div class="line">You would be, sweet madam, if your miseries were in</div>
                              <div class="line">the same abundance as your good fortunes are: and</div>
                              <div class="line">yet, for aught I see, they are as sick that surfeit</div>
                              <div class="line">with too much as they that starve with nothing. It</div>
                              <div class="line">is no mean happiness therefore, to be seated in the</div>
                              <div class="line">mean: superfluity comes sooner by white hairs, but</div>
                              <div class="line">competency lives longer.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PORTIA</div>
                              <div class="line">Good sentences and well pronounced.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">NERISSA</div>
                              <div class="line">They would be better, if well followed.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PORTIA</div>
                              <div class="line">If to do were as easy as to know what were good to</div>
                              <div class="line">do, chapels had been churches and poor men's</div>
                              <div class="line">cottages princes' palaces. It is a good divine that</div>
                              <div class="line">follows his own instructions: I can easier teach</div>
                              <div class="line">twenty what were good to be done, than be one of the</div>
