                              <div class="line">twenty to follow mine own teaching. The brain may</div>
                              <div class="line">devise laws for the blood, but a hot temper leaps</div>
                              <div class="line">o'er a cold decree: such a hare is madness the</div>
                              <div class="line">youth, to skip o'er the meshes of good counsel the</div>
                              <div class="line">cripple. But this reasoning is not in the fashion to</div>
                              <div class="line">choose me a husband. O me, the word 'choose!' I may</div>
                              <div class="line">neither choose whom I would nor refuse whom I</div>
                              <div class="line">dislike; so is the will of a living daughter curbed</div>
                              <div class="line">by the will of a dead father. Is it not hard,</div>
                              <div class="line">Nerissa, that I cannot choose one nor refuse none?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">NERISSA</div>
                              <div class="line">Your father was ever virtuous; and holy men at their</div>
                              <div class="line">death have good inspirations: therefore the lottery,</div>
                              <div class="line">that he hath devised in these three chests of gold,</div>
                              <div class="line">silver and lead, whereof who chooses his meaning</div>
                              <div class="line">chooses you, will, no doubt, never be chosen by any</div>
                              <div class="line">rightly but one who shall rightly love. But what</div>
                              <div class="line">warmth is there in your affection towards any of</div>
                              <div class="line">these princely suitors that are already come?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PORTIA</div>
                              <div class="line">I pray thee, over-name them; and as thou namest</div>
                              <div class="line">them, I will describe them; and, according to my</div>
                              <div class="line">description, level at my affection.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">NERISSA</div>
                              <div class="line">First, there is the Neapolitan prince.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PORTIA</div>
                              <div class="line">Ay, that's a colt indeed, for he doth nothing but</div>
                              <div class="line">talk of his horse; and he makes it a great</div>
                              <div class="line">appropriation to his own good parts, that he can</div>
                              <div class="line">shoe him himself. I am much afeard my lady his</div>
                              <div class="line">mother played false with a smith.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">NERISSA</div>
                              <div class="line">Then there is the County Palatine.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PORTIA</div>
                              <div class="line">He doth nothing but frown, as who should say 'If you</div>
                              <div class="line">will not have me, choose:' he hears merry tales and</div>
                              <div class="line">smiles not: I fear he will prove the weeping</div>
                              <div class="line">philosopher when he grows old, being so full of</div>
                              <div class="line">unmannerly sadness in his youth. I had rather be</div>
                              <div class="line">married to a death's-head with a bone in his mouth</div>
                              <div class="line">than to either of these. God defend me from these</div>
                              <div class="line">two!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">NERISSA</div>
                              <div class="line">How say you by the French lord, Monsieur Le Bon?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PORTIA</div>
                              <div class="line">God made him, and therefore let him pass for a man.</div>
                              <div class="line">In truth, I know it is a sin to be a mocker: but,</div>
                              <div class="line">he! why, he hath a horse better than the</div>
                              <div class="line">Neapolitan's, a better bad habit of frowning than</div>
                              <div class="line">the Count Palatine; he is every man in no man; if a</div>
                              <div class="line">throstle sing, he falls straight a capering: he will</div>
                              <div class="line">fence with his own shadow: if I should marry him, I</div>
                              <div class="line">should marry twenty husbands. If he would despise me</div>
                              <div class="line">I would forgive him, for if he love me to madness, I</div>
                              <div class="line">shall never requite him.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">NERISSA</div>
                              <div class="line">What say you, then, to Falconbridge, the young baron</div>
                              <div class="line">of England?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PORTIA</div>
                              <div class="line">You know I say nothing to him, for he understands</div>
                              <div class="line">not me, nor I him: he hath neither Latin, French,</div>
                              <div class="line">nor Italian, and you will come into the court and</div>
                              <div class="line">swear that I have a poor pennyworth in the English.</div>
                              <div class="line">He is a proper man's picture, but, alas, who can</div>
                              <div class="line">converse with a dumb-show? How oddly he is suited!</div>
                              <div class="line">I think he bought his doublet in Italy, his round</div>
                              <div class="line">hose in France, his bonnet in Germany and his</div>
                              <div class="line">behavior every where.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">NERISSA</div>
                              <div class="line">What think you of the Scottish lord, his neighbour?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PORTIA</div>
                              <div class="line">That he hath a neighbourly charity in him, for he</div>
                              <div class="line">borrowed a box of the ear of the Englishman and</div>
                              <div class="line">swore he would pay him again when he was able: I</div>
                              <div class="line">think the Frenchman became his surety and sealed</div>
                              <div class="line">under for another.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">NERISSA</div>
                              <div class="line">How like you the young German, the Duke of Saxony's nephew?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PORTIA</div>
                              <div class="line">Very vilely in the morning, when he is sober, and</div>
                              <div class="line">most vilely in the afternoon, when he is drunk: when</div>
                              <div class="line">he is best, he is a little worse than a man, and</div>
                              <div class="line">when he is worst, he is little better than a beast:</div>
                              <div class="line">and the worst fall that ever fell, I hope I shall</div>
                              <div class="line">make shift to go without him.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">NERISSA</div>
                              <div class="line">If he should offer to choose, and choose the right</div>
                              <div class="line">casket, you should refuse to perform your father's</div>
                              <div class="line">will, if you should refuse to accept him.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PORTIA</div>
                              <div class="line">Therefore, for fear of the worst, I pray thee, set a</div>
                              <div class="line">deep glass of rhenish wine on the contrary casket,</div>
                              <div class="line">for if the devil be within and that temptation</div>
                              <div class="line">without, I know he will choose it. I will do any</div>
                              <div class="line">thing, Nerissa, ere I'll be married to a sponge.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">NERISSA</div>
                              <div class="line">You need not fear, lady, the having any of these</div>
                              <div class="line">lords: they have acquainted me with their</div>
                              <div class="line">determinations; which is, indeed, to return to their</div>
                              <div class="line">home and to trouble you with no more suit, unless</div>
                              <div class="line">you may be won by some other sort than your father's</div>
                              <div class="line">imposition depending on the caskets.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PORTIA</div>
                              <div class="line">If I live to be as old as Sibylla, I will die as</div>
                              <div class="line">chaste as Diana, unless I be obtained by the manner</div>
                              <div class="line">of my father's will. I am glad this parcel of wooers</div>
                              <div class="line">are so reasonable, for there is not one among them</div>
                              <div class="line">but I dote on his very absence, and I pray God grant</div>
                              <div class="line">them a fair departure.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">NERISSA</div>
                              <div class="line">Do you not remember, lady, in your father's time, a</div>
                              <div class="line">Venetian, a scholar and a soldier, that came hither</div>
                              <div class="line">in company of the Marquis of Montferrat?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PORTIA</div>
                              <div class="line">Yes, yes, it was Bassanio; as I think, he was so called.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">NERISSA</div>
                              <div class="line">True, madam: he, of all the men that ever my foolish</div>
                              <div class="line">eyes looked upon, was the best deserving a fair lady.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PORTIA</div>
                              <div class="line">I remember him well, and I remember him worthy of</div>
                              <div class="line">thy praise.</div>
                              <p>Enter a Serving-man</p>
                              <div class="line">How now! what news?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Servant</div>
                              <div class="line">The four strangers seek for you, madam, to take</div>
                              <div class="line">their leave: and there is a forerunner come from a</div>
                              <div class="line">fifth, the Prince of Morocco, who brings word the</div>
                              <div class="line">prince his master will be here to-night.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PORTIA</div>
                              <div class="line">If I could bid the fifth welcome with so good a</div>
                              <div class="line">heart as I can bid the other four farewell, I should</div>
                              <div class="line">be glad of his approach: if he have the condition</div>
                              <div class="line">of a saint and the complexion of a devil, I had</div>
                              <div class="line">rather he should shrive me than wive me. Come,</div>
                              <div class="line">Nerissa. Sirrah, go before.</div>
                              <div class="line">Whiles we shut the gates</div>
                              <div class="line">upon one wooer, another knocks at the door.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt</p>
                     </div>
                  </section>
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.3.4">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>3. SCENE III.  Venice. A public place.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Enter BASSANIO and SHYLOCK</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SHYLOCK</div>
                              <div class="line">Three thousand ducats; well.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BASSANIO</div>
                              <div class="line">Ay, sir, for three months.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SHYLOCK</div>
                              <div class="line">For three months; well.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BASSANIO</div>
                              <div class="line">For the which, as I told you, Antonio shall be bound.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SHYLOCK</div>
                              <div class="line">Antonio shall become bound; well.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BASSANIO</div>
                              <div class="line">May you stead me? will you pleasure me? shall I</div>
                              <div class="line">know your answer?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SHYLOCK</div>
                              <div class="line">Three thousand ducats for three months and Antonio bound.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BASSANIO</div>
                              <div class="line">Your answer to that.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SHYLOCK</div>
                              <div class="line">Antonio is a good man.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BASSANIO</div>
                              <div class="line">Have you heard any imputation to the contrary?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SHYLOCK</div>
                              <div class="line">Oh, no, no, no, no: my meaning in saying he is a</div>
                              <div class="line">good man is to have you understand me that he is</div>
                              <div class="line">sufficient. Yet his means are in supposition: he</div>
                              <div class="line">hath an argosy bound to Tripolis, another to the</div>
                              <div class="line">Indies; I understand moreover, upon the Rialto, he</div>
                              <div class="line">hath a third at Mexico, a fourth for England, and</div>
                              <div class="line">other ventures he hath, squandered abroad. But ships</div>
                              <div class="line">are but boards, sailors but men: there be land-rats</div>
                              <div class="line">and water-rats, water-thieves and land-thieves, I</div>
                              <div class="line">mean pirates, and then there is the peril of waters,</div>
                              <div class="line">winds and rocks. The man is, notwithstanding,</div>
                              <div class="line">sufficient. Three thousand ducats; I think I may</div>
                              <div class="line">take his bond.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BASSANIO</div>
                              <div class="line">Be assured you may.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SHYLOCK</div>
                              <div class="line">I will be assured I may; and, that I may be assured,</div>
                              <div class="line">I will bethink me. May I speak with Antonio?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BASSANIO</div>
                              <div class="line">If it please you to dine with us.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SHYLOCK</div>
                              <div class="line">Yes, to smell pork; to eat of the habitation which</div>
                              <div class="line">your prophet the Nazarite conjured the devil into. I</div>
                              <div class="line">will buy with you, sell with you, talk with you,</div>
                              <div class="line">walk with you, and so following, but I will not eat</div>
                              <div class="line">with you, drink with you, nor pray with you. What</div>
                              <div class="line">news on the Rialto? Who is he comes here?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter ANTONIO</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BASSANIO</div>
                              <div class="line">This is Signior Antonio.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SHYLOCK</div>
                              <div class="line">
                                 <span>Aside</span>  How like a fawning publican he looks!</div>
                              <div class="line">I hate him for he is a Christian,</div>
                              <div class="line">But more for that in low simplicity</div>
                              <div class="line">He lends out money gratis and brings down</div>
                              <div class="line">The rate of usance here with us in Venice.</div>
                              <div class="line">If I can catch him once upon the hip,</div>
                              <div class="line">I will feed fat the ancient grudge I bear him.</div>
                              <div class="line">He hates our sacred nation, and he rails,</div>
                              <div class="line">Even there where merchants most do congregate,</div>
                              <div class="line">On me, my bargains and my well-won thrift,</div>
                              <div class="line">Which he calls interest. Cursed be my tribe,</div>
                              <div class="line">If I forgive him!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BASSANIO</div>
                              <div class="line">Shylock, do you hear?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SHYLOCK</div>
                              <div class="line">I am debating of my present store,</div>
                              <div class="line">And, by the near guess of my memory,</div>
                              <div class="line">I cannot instantly raise up the gross</div>
                              <div class="line">Of full three thousand ducats. What of that?</div>
                              <div class="line">Tubal, a wealthy Hebrew of my tribe,</div>
                              <div class="line">Will furnish me. But soft! how many months</div>
                              <div class="line">Do you desire?</div>
                              <p>To ANTONIO</p>
                              <div class="line">Rest you fair, good signior;</div>
                              <div class="line">Your worship was the last man in our mouths.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ANTONIO</div>
                              <div class="line">Shylock, although I neither lend nor borrow</div>
                              <div class="line">By taking nor by giving of excess,</div>
                              <div class="line">Yet, to supply the ripe wants of my friend,</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll break a custom. Is he yet possess'd</div>
                              <div class="line">How much ye would?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SHYLOCK</div>
                              <div class="line">Ay, ay, three thousand ducats.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ANTONIO</div>
                              <div class="line">And for three months.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SHYLOCK</div>
                              <div class="line">I had forgot; three months; you told me so.</div>
                              <div class="line">Well then, your bond; and let me see; but hear you;</div>
                              <div class="line">Methought you said you neither lend nor borrow</div>
                              <div class="line">Upon advantage.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ANTONIO</div>
                              <div class="line">I do never use it.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SHYLOCK</div>
                              <div class="line">When Jacob grazed his uncle Laban's sheep--</div>
                              <div class="line">This Jacob from our holy Abram was,</div>
                              <div class="line">As his wise mother wrought in his behalf,</div>
                              <div class="line">The third possessor; ay, he was the third--</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ANTONIO</div>
                              <div class="line">And what of him? did he take interest?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SHYLOCK</div>
                              <div class="line">No, not take interest, not, as you would say,</div>
                              <div class="line">Directly interest: mark what Jacob did.</div>
                              <div class="line">When Laban and himself were compromised</div>
                              <div class="line">That all the eanlings which were streak'd and pied</div>
                              <div class="line">Should fall as Jacob's hire, the ewes, being rank,</div>
                              <div class="line">In the end of autumn turned to the rams,</div>
                              <div class="line">And, when the work of generation was</div>
                              <div class="line">Between these woolly breeders in the act,</div>
                              <div class="line">The skilful shepherd peel'd me certain wands,</div>
                              <div class="line">And, in the doing of the deed of kind,</div>
                              <div class="line">He stuck them up before the fulsome ewes,</div>
                              <div class="line">Who then conceiving did in eaning time</div>
                              <div class="line">Fall parti-colour'd lambs, and those were Jacob's.</div>
                              <div class="line">This was a way to thrive, and he was blest:</div>
                              <div class="line">And thrift is blessing, if men steal it not.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ANTONIO</div>
                              <div class="line">This was a venture, sir, that Jacob served for;</div>
                              <div class="line">A thing not in his power to bring to pass,</div>
                              <div class="line">But sway'd and fashion'd by the hand of heaven.</div>
                              <div class="line">Was this inserted to make interest good?</div>
                              <div class="line">Or is your gold and silver ewes and rams?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SHYLOCK</div>
                              <div class="line">I cannot tell; I make it breed as fast:</div>
                              <div class="line">But note me, signior.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ANTONIO</div>
                              <div class="line">Mark you this, Bassanio,</div>
                              <div class="line">The devil can cite Scripture for his purpose.</div>
                              <div class="line">An evil soul producing holy witness</div>
                              <div class="line">Is like a villain with a smiling cheek,</div>
                              <div class="line">A goodly apple rotten at the heart:</div>
                              <div class="line">O, what a goodly outside falsehood hath!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SHYLOCK</div>
                              <div class="line">Three thousand ducats; 'tis a good round sum.</div>
                              <div class="line">Three months from twelve; then, let me see; the rate--</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ANTONIO</div>
                              <div class="line">Well, Shylock, shall we be beholding to you?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SHYLOCK</div>
                              <div class="line">Signior Antonio, many a time and oft</div>
                              <div class="line">In the Rialto you have rated me</div>
                              <div class="line">About my moneys and my usances:</div>
                              <div class="line">Still have I borne it with a patient shrug,</div>
                              <div class="line">For sufferance is the badge of all our tribe.</div>
                              <div class="line">You call me misbeliever, cut-throat dog,</div>
                              <div class="line">And spit upon my Jewish gaberdine,</div>
                              <div class="line">And all for use of that which is mine own.</div>
                              <div class="line">Well then, it now appears you need my help:</div>
                              <div class="line">Go to, then; you come to me, and you say</div>
                              <div class="line">'Shylock, we would have moneys:' you say so;</div>
                              <div class="line">You, that did void your rheum upon my beard</div>
                              <div class="line">And foot me as you spurn a stranger cur</div>
                              <div class="line">Over your threshold: moneys is your suit</div>
                              <div class="line">What should I say to you? Should I not say</div>
                              <div class="line">'Hath a dog money? is it possible</div>
                              <div class="line">A cur can lend three thousand ducats?' Or</div>
                              <div class="line">Shall I bend low and in a bondman's key,</div>
                              <div class="line">With bated breath and whispering humbleness, Say this;</div>
                              <div class="line">'Fair sir, you spit on me on Wednesday last;</div>
                              <div class="line">You spurn'd me such a day; another time</div>
                              <div class="line">You call'd me dog; and for these courtesies</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll lend you thus much moneys'?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ANTONIO</div>
                              <div class="line">I am as like to call thee so again,</div>
                              <div class="line">To spit on thee again, to spurn thee too.</div>
                              <div class="line">If thou wilt lend this money, lend it not</div>
                              <div class="line">As to thy friends; for when did friendship take</div>
                              <div class="line">A breed for barren metal of his friend?</div>
                              <div class="line">But lend it rather to thine enemy,</div>
                              <div class="line">Who, if he break, thou mayst with better face</div>
                              <div class="line">Exact the penalty.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SHYLOCK</div>
                              <div class="line">Why, look you, how you storm!</div>
                              <div class="line">I would be friends with you and have your love,</div>
                              <div class="line">Forget the shames that you have stain'd me with,</div>
                              <div class="line">Supply your present wants and take no doit</div>
                              <div class="line">Of usance for my moneys, and you'll not hear me:</div>
                              <div class="line">This is kind I offer.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BASSANIO</div>
                              <div class="line">This were kindness.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SHYLOCK</div>
                              <div class="line">This kindness will I show.</div>
                              <div class="line">Go with me to a notary, seal me there</div>
                              <div class="line">Your single bond; and, in a merry sport,</div>
                              <div class="line">If you repay me not on such a day,</div>
                              <div class="line">In such a place, such sum or sums as are</div>
                              <div class="line">Express'd in the condition, let the forfeit</div>
                              <div class="line">Be nominated for an equal pound</div>
                              <div class="line">Of your fair flesh, to be cut off and taken</div>
                              <div class="line">In what part of your body pleaseth me.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ANTONIO</div>
                              <div class="line">Content, i' faith: I'll seal to such a bond</div>
                              <div class="line">And say there is much kindness in the Jew.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BASSANIO</div>
                              <div class="line">You shall not seal to such a bond for me:</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll rather dwell in my necessity.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ANTONIO</div>
                              <div class="line">Why, fear not, man; I will not forfeit it:</div>
                              <div class="line">Within these two months, that's a month before</div>
                              <div class="line">This bond expires, I do expect return</div>
                              <div class="line">Of thrice three times the value of this bond.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SHYLOCK</div>
                              <div class="line">O father Abram, what these Christians are,</div>
                              <div class="line">Whose own hard dealings teaches them suspect</div>
                              <div class="line">The thoughts of others! Pray you, tell me this;</div>
                              <div class="line">If he should break his day, what should I gain</div>
                              <div class="line">By the exaction of the forfeiture?</div>
                              <div class="line">A pound of man's flesh taken from a man</div>
                              <div class="line">Is not so estimable, profitable neither,</div>
                              <div class="line">As flesh of muttons, beefs, or goats. I say,</div>
                              <div class="line">To buy his favour, I extend this friendship:</div>
                              <div class="line">If he will take it, so; if not, adieu;</div>
                              <div class="line">And, for my love, I pray you wrong me not.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ANTONIO</div>
                              <div class="line">Yes Shylock, I will seal unto this bond.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SHYLOCK</div>
                              <div class="line">Then meet me forthwith at the notary's;</div>
                              <div class="line">Give him direction for this merry bond,</div>
                              <div class="line">And I will go and purse the ducats straight,</div>
                              <div class="line">See to my house, left in the fearful guard</div>
                              <div class="line">Of an unthrifty knave, and presently</div>
                              <div class="line">I will be with you.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ANTONIO</div>
                              <div class="line">Hie thee, gentle Jew.</div>
                              <p>Exit Shylock</p>
                              <div class="line">The Hebrew will turn Christian: he grows kind.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BASSANIO</div>
                              <div class="line">I like not fair terms and a villain's mind.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ANTONIO</div>
                              <div class="line">Come on: in this there can be no dismay;</div>
                              <div class="line">My ships come home a month before the day.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt</p>
                     </div>
                  </section>
               </div>
            </article>
            <article class="chapter" id="R.1.4">
               <header class="chapter-titlepage">
                  <h2>Chapter 2. ACT II</h2>
               </header>
               <div class="lists-of-titles">
                  <div class="toc">
                     <p>
                        <b>Table of Contents</b>
                     </p>
                     <ul class="toc">
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.4.2">1. SCENE I.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.4.3">2. SCENE II.  Venice. A street.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.4.4">3. SCENE III.  The same. A room in SHYLOCK'S house.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.4.5">4. SCENE IV.  The same. A street.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.4.6">5. SCENE V.  The same. Before SHYLOCK'S house.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.4.7">6. SCENE VI.  The same.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.4.8">7. SCENE VII.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.4.9">8. SCENE VIII.  Venice. A street.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.4.10">9. SCENE IX.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                     </ul>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="content">
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.4.2">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>1. SCENE I.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Flourish of cornets. Enter the PRINCE OF MOROCCO
and his train; PORTIA, NERISSA, and others
attending</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MOROCCO</div>
                              <div class="line">Mislike me not for my complexion,</div>
                              <div class="line">The shadow'd livery of the burnish'd sun,</div>
                              <div class="line">To whom I am a neighbour and near bred.</div>
                              <div class="line">Bring me the fairest creature northward born,</div>
                              <div class="line">Where Phoebus' fire scarce thaws the icicles,</div>
                              <div class="line">And let us make incision for your love,</div>
                              <div class="line">To prove whose blood is reddest, his or mine.</div>
                              <div class="line">I tell thee, lady, this aspect of mine</div>
                              <div class="line">Hath fear'd the valiant: by my love I swear</div>
                              <div class="line">The best-regarded virgins of our clime</div>
                              <div class="line">Have loved it too: I would not change this hue,</div>
                              <div class="line">Except to steal your thoughts, my gentle queen.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PORTIA</div>
                              <div class="line">In terms of choice I am not solely led</div>
                              <div class="line">By nice direction of a maiden's eyes;</div>
                              <div class="line">Besides, the lottery of my destiny</div>
                              <div class="line">Bars me the right of voluntary choosing:</div>
                              <div class="line">But if my father had not scanted me</div>
                              <div class="line">And hedged me by his wit, to yield myself</div>
                              <div class="line">His wife who wins me by that means I told you,</div>
                              <div class="line">Yourself, renowned prince, then stood as fair</div>
                              <div class="line">As any comer I have look'd on yet</div>
                              <div class="line">For my affection.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MOROCCO</div>
                              <div class="line">Even for that I thank you:</div>
                              <div class="line">Therefore, I pray you, lead me to the caskets</div>
                              <div class="line">To try my fortune. By this scimitar</div>
                              <div class="line">That slew the Sophy and a Persian prince</div>
                              <div class="line">That won three fields of Sultan Solyman,</div>
                              <div class="line">I would outstare the sternest eyes that look,</div>
                              <div class="line">Outbrave the heart most daring on the earth,</div>
                              <div class="line">Pluck the young sucking cubs from the she-bear,</div>
                              <div class="line">Yea, mock the lion when he roars for prey,</div>
                              <div class="line">To win thee, lady. But, alas the while!</div>
                              <div class="line">If Hercules and Lichas play at dice</div>
                              <div class="line">Which is the better man, the greater throw</div>
                              <div class="line">May turn by fortune from the weaker hand:</div>
                              <div class="line">So is Alcides beaten by his page;</div>
                              <div class="line">And so may I, blind fortune leading me,</div>
                              <div class="line">Miss that which one unworthier may attain,</div>
                              <div class="line">And die with grieving.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PORTIA</div>
                              <div class="line">You must take your chance,</div>
                              <div class="line">And either not attempt to choose at all</div>
                              <div class="line">Or swear before you choose, if you choose wrong</div>
                              <div class="line">Never to speak to lady afterward</div>
                              <div class="line">In way of marriage: therefore be advised.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MOROCCO</div>
                              <div class="line">Nor will not. Come, bring me unto my chance.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PORTIA</div>
                              <div class="line">First, forward to the temple: after dinner</div>
                              <div class="line">Your hazard shall be made.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">MOROCCO</div>
                              <div class="line">Good fortune then!</div>
                              <div class="line">To make me blest or cursed'st among men.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Cornets, and exeunt</p>
                     </div>
                  </section>
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.4.3">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>2. SCENE II.  Venice. A street.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Enter LAUNCELOT</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LAUNCELOT</div>
                              <div class="line">Certainly my conscience will serve me to run from</div>
                              <div class="line">this Jew my master. The fiend is at mine elbow and</div>
                              <div class="line">tempts me saying to me 'Gobbo, Launcelot Gobbo, good</div>
                              <div class="line">Launcelot,' or 'good Gobbo,' or good Launcelot</div>
                              <div class="line">Gobbo, use your legs, take the start, run away. My</div>
                              <div class="line">conscience says 'No; take heed,' honest Launcelot;</div>
                              <div class="line">take heed, honest Gobbo, or, as aforesaid, 'honest</div>
                              <div class="line">Launcelot Gobbo; do not run; scorn running with thy</div>
                              <div class="line">heels.' Well, the most courageous fiend bids me</div>
                              <div class="line">pack: 'Via!' says the fiend; 'away!' says the</div>
                              <div class="line">fiend; 'for the heavens, rouse up a brave mind,'</div>
                              <div class="line">says the fiend, 'and run.' Well, my conscience,</div>
                              <div class="line">hanging about the neck of my heart, says very wisely</div>
                              <div class="line">to me 'My honest friend Launcelot, being an honest</div>
                              <div class="line">man's son,' or rather an honest woman's son; for,</div>
                              <div class="line">indeed, my father did something smack, something</div>
                              <div class="line">grow to, he had a kind of taste; well, my conscience</div>
                              <div class="line">says 'Launcelot, budge not.' 'Budge,' says the</div>
                              <div class="line">fiend. 'Budge not,' says my conscience.</div>
                              <div class="line">'Conscience,' say I, 'you counsel well;' ' Fiend,'</div>
                              <div class="line">say I, 'you counsel well:' to be ruled by my</div>
                              <div class="line">conscience, I should stay with the Jew my master,</div>
                              <div class="line">who, God bless the mark, is a kind of devil; and, to</div>
                              <div class="line">run away from the Jew, I should be ruled by the</div>
                              <div class="line">fiend, who, saving your reverence, is the devil</div>
                              <div class="line">himself. Certainly the Jew is the very devil</div>
                              <div class="line">incarnal; and, in my conscience, my conscience is</div>
                              <div class="line">but a kind of hard conscience, to offer to counsel</div>
                              <div class="line">me to stay with the Jew. The fiend gives the more</div>
                              <div class="line">friendly counsel: I will run, fiend; my heels are</div>
                              <div class="line">at your command; I will run.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter Old GOBBO, with a basket</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GOBBO</div>
                              <div class="line">Master young man, you, I pray you, which is the way</div>
                              <div class="line">to master Jew's?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LAUNCELOT</div>
                              <div class="line">
                                 <span>Aside</span>  O heavens, this is my true-begotten father!</div>
                              <div class="line">who, being more than sand-blind, high-gravel blind,</div>
                              <div class="line">knows me not: I will try confusions with him.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GOBBO</div>
                              <div class="line">Master young gentleman, I pray you, which is the way</div>
                              <div class="line">to master Jew's?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LAUNCELOT</div>
                              <div class="line">Turn up on your right hand at the next turning, but,</div>
                              <div class="line">at the next turning of all, on your left; marry, at</div>
                              <div class="line">the very next turning, turn of no hand, but turn</div>
                              <div class="line">down indirectly to the Jew's house.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GOBBO</div>
                              <div class="line">By God's sonties, 'twill be a hard way to hit. Can</div>
                              <div class="line">you tell me whether one Launcelot,</div>
                              <div class="line">that dwells with him, dwell with him or no?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LAUNCELOT</div>
                              <div class="line">Talk you of young Master Launcelot?</div>
                              <p>Aside</p>
                              <div class="line">Mark me now; now will I raise the waters. Talk you</div>
                              <div class="line">of young Master Launcelot?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GOBBO</div>
                              <div class="line">No master, sir, but a poor man's son: his father,</div>
                              <div class="line">though I say it, is an honest exceeding poor man</div>
                              <div class="line">and, God be thanked, well to live.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LAUNCELOT</div>
                              <div class="line">Well, let his father be what a' will, we talk of</div>
                              <div class="line">young Master Launcelot.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GOBBO</div>
                              <div class="line">Your worship's friend and Launcelot, sir.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LAUNCELOT</div>
                              <div class="line">But I pray you, ergo, old man, ergo, I beseech you,</div>
                              <div class="line">talk you of young Master Launcelot?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GOBBO</div>
                              <div class="line">Of Launcelot, an't please your mastership.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LAUNCELOT</div>
                              <div class="line">Ergo, Master Launcelot. Talk not of Master</div>
                              <div class="line">Launcelot, father; for the young gentleman,</div>
                              <div class="line">according to Fates and Destinies and such odd</div>
                              <div class="line">sayings, the Sisters Three and such branches of</div>
                              <div class="line">learning, is indeed deceased, or, as you would say</div>
                              <div class="line">in plain terms, gone to heaven.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GOBBO</div>
                              <div class="line">Marry, God forbid! the boy was the very staff of my</div>
                              <div class="line">age, my very prop.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LAUNCELOT</div>
                              <div class="line">Do I look like a cudgel or a hovel-post, a staff or</div>
                              <div class="line">a prop? Do you know me, father?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GOBBO</div>
                              <div class="line">Alack the day, I know you not, young gentleman:</div>
                              <div class="line">but, I pray you, tell me, is my boy, God rest his</div>
                              <div class="line">soul, alive or dead?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LAUNCELOT</div>
                              <div class="line">Do you not know me, father?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GOBBO</div>
                              <div class="line">Alack, sir, I am sand-blind; I know you not.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LAUNCELOT</div>
                              <div class="line">Nay, indeed, if you had your eyes, you might fail of</div>
                              <div class="line">the knowing me: it is a wise father that knows his</div>
                              <div class="line">own child. Well, old man, I will tell you news of</div>
                              <div class="line">your son: give me your blessing: truth will come</div>
                              <div class="line">to light; murder cannot be hid long; a man's son</div>
                              <div class="line">may, but at the length truth will out.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GOBBO</div>
                              <div class="line">Pray you, sir, stand up: I am sure you are not</div>
                              <div class="line">Launcelot, my boy.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LAUNCELOT</div>
                              <div class="line">Pray you, let's have no more fooling about it, but</div>
                              <div class="line">give me your blessing: I am Launcelot, your boy</div>
                              <div class="line">that was, your son that is, your child that shall</div>
                              <div class="line">be.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GOBBO</div>
                              <div class="line">I cannot think you are my son.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LAUNCELOT</div>
                              <div class="line">I know not what I shall think of that: but I am</div>
                              <div class="line">Launcelot, the Jew's man, and I am sure Margery your</div>
                              <div class="line">wife is my mother.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GOBBO</div>
                              <div class="line">Her name is Margery, indeed: I'll be sworn, if thou</div>
                              <div class="line">be Launcelot, thou art mine own flesh and blood.</div>
                              <div class="line">Lord worshipped might he be! what a beard hast thou</div>
                              <div class="line">got! thou hast got more hair on thy chin than</div>
                              <div class="line">Dobbin my fill-horse has on his tail.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LAUNCELOT</div>
                              <div class="line">It should seem, then, that Dobbin's tail grows</div>
                              <div class="line">backward: I am sure he had more hair of his tail</div>
                              <div class="line">than I have of my face when I last saw him.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GOBBO</div>
                              <div class="line">Lord, how art thou changed! How dost thou and thy</div>
                              <div class="line">master agree? I have brought him a present. How</div>
                              <div class="line">'gree you now?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LAUNCELOT</div>
                              <div class="line">Well, well: but, for mine own part, as I have set</div>
                              <div class="line">up my rest to run away, so I will not rest till I</div>
                              <div class="line">have run some ground. My master's a very Jew: give</div>
                              <div class="line">him a present! give him a halter: I am famished in</div>
                              <div class="line">his service; you may tell every finger I have with</div>
                              <div class="line">my ribs. Father, I am glad you are come: give me</div>
                              <div class="line">your present to one Master Bassanio, who, indeed,</div>
                              <div class="line">gives rare new liveries: if I serve not him, I</div>
                              <div class="line">will run as far as God has any ground. O rare</div>
                              <div class="line">fortune! here comes the man: to him, father; for I</div>
                              <div class="line">am a Jew, if I serve the Jew any longer.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter BASSANIO, with LEONARDO and other followers</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BASSANIO</div>
                              <div class="line">You may do so; but let it be so hasted that supper</div>
                              <div class="line">be ready at the farthest by five of the clock. See</div>
                              <div class="line">these letters delivered; put the liveries to making,</div>
                              <div class="line">and desire Gratiano to come anon to my lodging.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exit a Servant</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LAUNCELOT</div>
                              <div class="line">To him, father.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GOBBO</div>
                              <div class="line">God bless your worship!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BASSANIO</div>
                              <div class="line">Gramercy! wouldst thou aught with me?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GOBBO</div>
                              <div class="line">Here's my son, sir, a poor boy,--</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LAUNCELOT</div>
                              <div class="line">Not a poor boy, sir, but the rich Jew's man; that</div>
                              <div class="line">would, sir, as my father shall specify--</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GOBBO</div>
                              <div class="line">He hath a great infection, sir, as one would say, to serve--</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LAUNCELOT</div>
                              <div class="line">Indeed, the short and the long is, I serve the Jew,</div>
                              <div class="line">and have a desire, as my father shall specify--</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GOBBO</div>
                              <div class="line">His master and he, saving your worship's reverence,</div>
                              <div class="line">are scarce cater-cousins--</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LAUNCELOT</div>
                              <div class="line">To be brief, the very truth is that the Jew, having</div>
                              <div class="line">done me wrong, doth cause me, as my father, being, I</div>
                              <div class="line">hope, an old man, shall frutify unto you--</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GOBBO</div>
                              <div class="line">I have here a dish of doves that I would bestow upon</div>
                              <div class="line">your worship, and my suit is--</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LAUNCELOT</div>
                              <div class="line">In very brief, the suit is impertinent to myself, as</div>
                              <div class="line">your worship shall know by this honest old man; and,</div>
                              <div class="line">though I say it, though old man, yet poor man, my father.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BASSANIO</div>
                              <div class="line">One speak for both. What would you?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LAUNCELOT</div>
                              <div class="line">Serve you, sir.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GOBBO</div>
                              <div class="line">That is the very defect of the matter, sir.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BASSANIO</div>
                              <div class="line">I know thee well; thou hast obtain'd thy suit:</div>
                              <div class="line">Shylock thy master spoke with me this day,</div>
                              <div class="line">And hath preferr'd thee, if it be preferment</div>
                              <div class="line">To leave a rich Jew's service, to become</div>
                              <div class="line">The follower of so poor a gentleman.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LAUNCELOT</div>
                              <div class="line">The old proverb is very well parted between my</div>
                              <div class="line">master Shylock and you, sir: you have the grace of</div>
                              <div class="line">God, sir, and he hath enough.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BASSANIO</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou speak'st it well. Go, father, with thy son.</div>
                              <div class="line">Take leave of thy old master and inquire</div>
                              <div class="line">My lodging out. Give him a livery</div>
                              <div class="line">More guarded than his fellows': see it done.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
