                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SHYLOCK</div>
                              <div class="line">You know, none so well, none so well as you, of my</div>
                              <div class="line">daughter's flight.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SALARINO</div>
                              <div class="line">That's certain: I, for my part, knew the tailor</div>
                              <div class="line">that made the wings she flew withal.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SALANIO</div>
                              <div class="line">And Shylock, for his own part, knew the bird was</div>
                              <div class="line">fledged; and then it is the complexion of them all</div>
                              <div class="line">to leave the dam.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SHYLOCK</div>
                              <div class="line">She is damned for it.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SALANIO</div>
                              <div class="line">That's certain, if the devil may be her judge.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SHYLOCK</div>
                              <div class="line">My own flesh and blood to rebel!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SALANIO</div>
                              <div class="line">Out upon it, old carrion! rebels it at these years?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SHYLOCK</div>
                              <div class="line">I say, my daughter is my flesh and blood.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SALARINO</div>
                              <div class="line">There is more difference between thy flesh and hers</div>
                              <div class="line">than between jet and ivory; more between your bloods</div>
                              <div class="line">than there is between red wine and rhenish. But</div>
                              <div class="line">tell us, do you hear whether Antonio have had any</div>
                              <div class="line">loss at sea or no?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SHYLOCK</div>
                              <div class="line">There I have another bad match: a bankrupt, a</div>
                              <div class="line">prodigal, who dare scarce show his head on the</div>
                              <div class="line">Rialto; a beggar, that was used to come so smug upon</div>
                              <div class="line">the mart; let him look to his bond: he was wont to</div>
                              <div class="line">call me usurer; let him look to his bond: he was</div>
                              <div class="line">wont to lend money for a Christian courtesy; let him</div>
                              <div class="line">look to his bond.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SALARINO</div>
                              <div class="line">Why, I am sure, if he forfeit, thou wilt not take</div>
                              <div class="line">his flesh: what's that good for?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SHYLOCK</div>
                              <div class="line">To bait fish withal: if it will feed nothing else,</div>
                              <div class="line">it will feed my revenge. He hath disgraced me, and</div>
                              <div class="line">hindered me half a million; laughed at my losses,</div>
                              <div class="line">mocked at my gains, scorned my nation, thwarted my</div>
                              <div class="line">bargains, cooled my friends, heated mine</div>
                              <div class="line">enemies; and what's his reason? I am a Jew. Hath</div>
                              <div class="line">not a Jew eyes? hath not a Jew hands, organs,</div>
                              <div class="line">dimensions, senses, affections, passions? fed with</div>
                              <div class="line">the same food, hurt with the same weapons, subject</div>
                              <div class="line">to the same diseases, healed by the same means,</div>
                              <div class="line">warmed and cooled by the same winter and summer, as</div>
                              <div class="line">a Christian is? If you prick us, do we not bleed?</div>
                              <div class="line">if you tickle us, do we not laugh? if you poison</div>
                              <div class="line">us, do we not die? and if you wrong us, shall we not</div>
                              <div class="line">revenge? If we are like you in the rest, we will</div>
                              <div class="line">resemble you in that. If a Jew wrong a Christian,</div>
                              <div class="line">what is his humility? Revenge. If a Christian</div>
                              <div class="line">wrong a Jew, what should his sufferance be by</div>
                              <div class="line">Christian example? Why, revenge. The villany you</div>
                              <div class="line">teach me, I will execute, and it shall go hard but I</div>
                              <div class="line">will better the instruction.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter a Servant</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Servant</div>
                              <div class="line">Gentlemen, my master Antonio is at his house and</div>
                              <div class="line">desires to speak with you both.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SALARINO</div>
                              <div class="line">We have been up and down to seek him.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter TUBAL</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SALANIO</div>
                              <div class="line">Here comes another of the tribe: a third cannot be</div>
                              <div class="line">matched, unless the devil himself turn Jew.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt SALANIO, SALARINO, and Servant</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SHYLOCK</div>
                              <div class="line">How now, Tubal! what news from Genoa? hast thou</div>
                              <div class="line">found my daughter?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">TUBAL</div>
                              <div class="line">I often came where I did hear of her, but cannot find her.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SHYLOCK</div>
                              <div class="line">Why, there, there, there, there! a diamond gone,</div>
                              <div class="line">cost me two thousand ducats in Frankfort! The curse</div>
                              <div class="line">never fell upon our nation till now; I never felt it</div>
                              <div class="line">till now: two thousand ducats in that; and other</div>
                              <div class="line">precious, precious jewels. I would my daughter</div>
                              <div class="line">were dead at my foot, and the jewels in her ear!</div>
                              <div class="line">would she were hearsed at my foot, and the ducats in</div>
                              <div class="line">her coffin! No news of them? Why, so: and I know</div>
                              <div class="line">not what's spent in the search: why, thou loss upon</div>
                              <div class="line">loss! the thief gone with so much, and so much to</div>
                              <div class="line">find the thief; and no satisfaction, no revenge:</div>
                              <div class="line">nor no in luck stirring but what lights on my</div>
                              <div class="line">shoulders; no sighs but of my breathing; no tears</div>
                              <div class="line">but of my shedding.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">TUBAL</div>
                              <div class="line">Yes, other men have ill luck too: Antonio, as I</div>
                              <div class="line">heard in Genoa,--</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SHYLOCK</div>
                              <div class="line">What, what, what? ill luck, ill luck?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">TUBAL</div>
                              <div class="line">Hath an argosy cast away, coming from Tripolis.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SHYLOCK</div>
                              <div class="line">I thank God, I thank God. Is't true, is't true?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">TUBAL</div>
                              <div class="line">I spoke with some of the sailors that escaped the wreck.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SHYLOCK</div>
                              <div class="line">I thank thee, good Tubal: good news, good news!</div>
                              <div class="line">ha, ha! where? in Genoa?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">TUBAL</div>
                              <div class="line">Your daughter spent in Genoa, as I heard, in one</div>
                              <div class="line">night fourscore ducats.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SHYLOCK</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou stickest a dagger in me: I shall never see my</div>
                              <div class="line">gold again: fourscore ducats at a sitting!</div>
                              <div class="line">fourscore ducats!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">TUBAL</div>
                              <div class="line">There came divers of Antonio's creditors in my</div>
                              <div class="line">company to Venice, that swear he cannot choose but break.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SHYLOCK</div>
                              <div class="line">I am very glad of it: I'll plague him; I'll torture</div>
                              <div class="line">him: I am glad of it.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">TUBAL</div>
                              <div class="line">One of them showed me a ring that he had of your</div>
                              <div class="line">daughter for a monkey.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SHYLOCK</div>
                              <div class="line">Out upon her! Thou torturest me, Tubal: it was my</div>
                              <div class="line">turquoise; I had it of Leah when I was a bachelor:</div>
                              <div class="line">I would not have given it for a wilderness of monkeys.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">TUBAL</div>
                              <div class="line">But Antonio is certainly undone.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SHYLOCK</div>
                              <div class="line">Nay, that's true, that's very true. Go, Tubal, fee</div>
                              <div class="line">me an officer; bespeak him a fortnight before. I</div>
                              <div class="line">will have the heart of him, if he forfeit; for, were</div>
                              <div class="line">he out of Venice, I can make what merchandise I</div>
                              <div class="line">will. Go, go, Tubal, and meet me at our synagogue;</div>
                              <div class="line">go, good Tubal; at our synagogue, Tubal.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt</p>
                     </div>
                  </section>
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.5.3">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>2. SCENE II.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Enter BASSANIO, PORTIA, GRATIANO, NERISSA, and
Attendants</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PORTIA</div>
                              <div class="line">I pray you, tarry: pause a day or two</div>
                              <div class="line">Before you hazard; for, in choosing wrong,</div>
                              <div class="line">I lose your company: therefore forbear awhile.</div>
                              <div class="line">There's something tells me, but it is not love,</div>
                              <div class="line">I would not lose you; and you know yourself,</div>
                              <div class="line">Hate counsels not in such a quality.</div>
                              <div class="line">But lest you should not understand me well,--</div>
                              <div class="line">And yet a maiden hath no tongue but thought,--</div>
                              <div class="line">I would detain you here some month or two</div>
                              <div class="line">Before you venture for me. I could teach you</div>
                              <div class="line">How to choose right, but I am then forsworn;</div>
                              <div class="line">So will I never be: so may you miss me;</div>
                              <div class="line">But if you do, you'll make me wish a sin,</div>
                              <div class="line">That I had been forsworn. Beshrew your eyes,</div>
                              <div class="line">They have o'erlook'd me and divided me;</div>
                              <div class="line">One half of me is yours, the other half yours,</div>
                              <div class="line">Mine own, I would say; but if mine, then yours,</div>
                              <div class="line">And so all yours. O, these naughty times</div>
                              <div class="line">Put bars between the owners and their rights!</div>
                              <div class="line">And so, though yours, not yours. Prove it so,</div>
                              <div class="line">Let fortune go to hell for it, not I.</div>
                              <div class="line">I speak too long; but 'tis to peize the time,</div>
                              <div class="line">To eke it and to draw it out in length,</div>
                              <div class="line">To stay you from election.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BASSANIO</div>
                              <div class="line">Let me choose</div>
                              <div class="line">For as I am, I live upon the rack.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PORTIA</div>
                              <div class="line">Upon the rack, Bassanio! then confess</div>
                              <div class="line">What treason there is mingled with your love.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BASSANIO</div>
                              <div class="line">None but that ugly treason of mistrust,</div>
                              <div class="line">Which makes me fear the enjoying of my love:</div>
                              <div class="line">There may as well be amity and life</div>
                              <div class="line">'Tween snow and fire, as treason and my love.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PORTIA</div>
                              <div class="line">Ay, but I fear you speak upon the rack,</div>
                              <div class="line">Where men enforced do speak anything.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BASSANIO</div>
                              <div class="line">Promise me life, and I'll confess the truth.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PORTIA</div>
                              <div class="line">Well then, confess and live.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BASSANIO</div>
                              <div class="line">'Confess' and 'love'</div>
                              <div class="line">Had been the very sum of my confession:</div>
                              <div class="line">O happy torment, when my torturer</div>
                              <div class="line">Doth teach me answers for deliverance!</div>
                              <div class="line">But let me to my fortune and the caskets.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PORTIA</div>
                              <div class="line">Away, then! I am lock'd in one of them:</div>
                              <div class="line">If you do love me, you will find me out.</div>
                              <div class="line">Nerissa and the rest, stand all aloof.</div>
                              <div class="line">Let music sound while he doth make his choice;</div>
                              <div class="line">Then, if he lose, he makes a swan-like end,</div>
                              <div class="line">Fading in music: that the comparison</div>
                              <div class="line">May stand more proper, my eye shall be the stream</div>
                              <div class="line">And watery death-bed for him. He may win;</div>
                              <div class="line">And what is music then? Then music is</div>
                              <div class="line">Even as the flourish when true subjects bow</div>
                              <div class="line">To a new-crowned monarch: such it is</div>
                              <div class="line">As are those dulcet sounds in break of day</div>
                              <div class="line">That creep into the dreaming bridegroom's ear,</div>
                              <div class="line">And summon him to marriage. Now he goes,</div>
                              <div class="line">With no less presence, but with much more love,</div>
                              <div class="line">Than young Alcides, when he did redeem</div>
                              <div class="line">The virgin tribute paid by howling Troy</div>
                              <div class="line">To the sea-monster: I stand for sacrifice</div>
                              <div class="line">The rest aloof are the Dardanian wives,</div>
                              <div class="line">With bleared visages, come forth to view</div>
                              <div class="line">The issue of the exploit. Go, Hercules!</div>
                              <div class="line">Live thou, I live: with much, much more dismay</div>
                              <div class="line">I view the fight than thou that makest the fray.</div>
                              <p>Music, whilst BASSANIO comments on the caskets to himself</p>
                              <h3 class="bridgehead">SONG.</h3>
                              <div class="line">Tell me where is fancy bred,</div>
                              <div class="line">Or in the heart, or in the head?</div>
                              <div class="line">How begot, how nourished?</div>
                              <div class="line">Reply, reply.</div>
                              <div class="line">It is engender'd in the eyes,</div>
                              <div class="line">With gazing fed; and fancy dies</div>
                              <div class="line">In the cradle where it lies.</div>
                              <div class="line">Let us all ring fancy's knell</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll begin it,--Ding, dong, bell.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ALL</div>
                              <div class="line">Ding, dong, bell.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BASSANIO</div>
                              <div class="line">So may the outward shows be least themselves:</div>
                              <div class="line">The world is still deceived with ornament.</div>
                              <div class="line">In law, what plea so tainted and corrupt,</div>
                              <div class="line">But, being seasoned with a gracious voice,</div>
                              <div class="line">Obscures the show of evil? In religion,</div>
                              <div class="line">What damned error, but some sober brow</div>
                              <div class="line">Will bless it and approve it with a text,</div>
                              <div class="line">Hiding the grossness with fair ornament?</div>
                              <div class="line">There is no vice so simple but assumes</div>
                              <div class="line">Some mark of virtue on his outward parts:</div>
                              <div class="line">How many cowards, whose hearts are all as false</div>
                              <div class="line">As stairs of sand, wear yet upon their chins</div>
                              <div class="line">The beards of Hercules and frowning Mars;</div>
                              <div class="line">Who, inward search'd, have livers white as milk;</div>
                              <div class="line">And these assume but valour's excrement</div>
                              <div class="line">To render them redoubted! Look on beauty,</div>
                              <div class="line">And you shall see 'tis purchased by the weight;</div>
                              <div class="line">Which therein works a miracle in nature,</div>
                              <div class="line">Making them lightest that wear most of it:</div>
                              <div class="line">So are those crisped snaky golden locks</div>
                              <div class="line">Which make such wanton gambols with the wind,</div>
                              <div class="line">Upon supposed fairness, often known</div>
                              <div class="line">To be the dowry of a second head,</div>
                              <div class="line">The skull that bred them in the sepulchre.</div>
                              <div class="line">Thus ornament is but the guiled shore</div>
                              <div class="line">To a most dangerous sea; the beauteous scarf</div>
                              <div class="line">Veiling an Indian beauty; in a word,</div>
                              <div class="line">The seeming truth which cunning times put on</div>
                              <div class="line">To entrap the wisest. Therefore, thou gaudy gold,</div>
                              <div class="line">Hard food for Midas, I will none of thee;</div>
                              <div class="line">Nor none of thee, thou pale and common drudge</div>
                              <div class="line">'Tween man and man: but thou, thou meagre lead,</div>
                              <div class="line">Which rather threatenest than dost promise aught,</div>
                              <div class="line">Thy paleness moves me more than eloquence;</div>
                              <div class="line">And here choose I; joy be the consequence!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PORTIA</div>
                              <div class="line">
                                 <span>Aside</span>  How all the other passions fleet to air,</div>
                              <div class="line">As doubtful thoughts, and rash-embraced despair,</div>
                              <div class="line">And shuddering fear, and green-eyed jealousy! O love,</div>
                              <div class="line">Be moderate; allay thy ecstasy,</div>
                              <div class="line">In measure rein thy joy; scant this excess.</div>
                              <div class="line">I feel too much thy blessing: make it less,</div>
                              <div class="line">For fear I surfeit.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BASSANIO</div>
                              <div class="line">What find I here?</div>
                              <p>Opening the leaden casket</p>
                              <div class="line">Fair Portia's counterfeit! What demi-god</div>
                              <div class="line">Hath come so near creation? Move these eyes?</div>
                              <div class="line">Or whether, riding on the balls of mine,</div>
                              <div class="line">Seem they in motion? Here are sever'd lips,</div>
                              <div class="line">Parted with sugar breath: so sweet a bar</div>
                              <div class="line">Should sunder such sweet friends. Here in her hairs</div>
                              <div class="line">The painter plays the spider and hath woven</div>
                              <div class="line">A golden mesh to entrap the hearts of men,</div>
                              <div class="line">Faster than gnats in cobwebs; but her eyes,--</div>
                              <div class="line">How could he see to do them? having made one,</div>
                              <div class="line">Methinks it should have power to steal both his</div>
                              <div class="line">And leave itself unfurnish'd. Yet look, how far</div>
                              <div class="line">The substance of my praise doth wrong this shadow</div>
                              <div class="line">In underprizing it, so far this shadow</div>
                              <div class="line">Doth limp behind the substance. Here's the scroll,</div>
                              <div class="line">The continent and summary of my fortune.</div>
                              <p>Reads</p>
                              <div class="line">You that choose not by the view,</div>
                              <div class="line">Chance as fair and choose as true!</div>
                              <div class="line">Since this fortune falls to you,</div>
                              <div class="line">Be content and seek no new,</div>
                              <div class="line">If you be well pleased with this</div>
                              <div class="line">And hold your fortune for your bliss,</div>
                              <div class="line">Turn you where your lady is</div>
                              <div class="line">And claim her with a loving kiss.</div>
                              <div class="line">A gentle scroll. Fair lady, by your leave;</div>
                              <div class="line">I come by note, to give and to receive.</div>
                              <div class="line">Like one of two contending in a prize,</div>
                              <div class="line">That thinks he hath done well in people's eyes,</div>
                              <div class="line">Hearing applause and universal shout,</div>
                              <div class="line">Giddy in spirit, still gazing in a doubt</div>
                              <div class="line">Whether these pearls of praise be his or no;</div>
                              <div class="line">So, thrice fair lady, stand I, even so;</div>
                              <div class="line">As doubtful whether what I see be true,</div>
                              <div class="line">Until confirm'd, sign'd, ratified by you.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PORTIA</div>
                              <div class="line">You see me, Lord Bassanio, where I stand,</div>
                              <div class="line">Such as I am: though for myself alone</div>
                              <div class="line">I would not be ambitious in my wish,</div>
                              <div class="line">To wish myself much better; yet, for you</div>
                              <div class="line">I would be trebled twenty times myself;</div>
                              <div class="line">A thousand times more fair, ten thousand times more rich;</div>
                              <div class="line">That only to stand high in your account,</div>
                              <div class="line">I might in virtue, beauties, livings, friends,</div>
                              <div class="line">Exceed account; but the full sum of me</div>
                              <div class="line">Is sum of something, which, to term in gross,</div>
                              <div class="line">Is an unlesson'd girl, unschool'd, unpractised;</div>
                              <div class="line">Happy in this, she is not yet so old</div>
                              <div class="line">But she may learn; happier than this,</div>
                              <div class="line">She is not bred so dull but she can learn;</div>
                              <div class="line">Happiest of all is that her gentle spirit</div>
                              <div class="line">Commits itself to yours to be directed,</div>
                              <div class="line">As from her lord, her governor, her king.</div>
                              <div class="line">Myself and what is mine to you and yours</div>
                              <div class="line">Is now converted: but now I was the lord</div>
                              <div class="line">Of this fair mansion, master of my servants,</div>
                              <div class="line">Queen o'er myself: and even now, but now,</div>
                              <div class="line">This house, these servants and this same myself</div>
                              <div class="line">Are yours, my lord: I give them with this ring;</div>
                              <div class="line">Which when you part from, lose, or give away,</div>
                              <div class="line">Let it presage the ruin of your love</div>
                              <div class="line">And be my vantage to exclaim on you.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BASSANIO</div>
                              <div class="line">Madam, you have bereft me of all words,</div>
                              <div class="line">Only my blood speaks to you in my veins;</div>
                              <div class="line">And there is such confusion in my powers,</div>
                              <div class="line">As after some oration fairly spoke</div>
                              <div class="line">By a beloved prince, there doth appear</div>
                              <div class="line">Among the buzzing pleased multitude;</div>
                              <div class="line">Where every something, being blent together,</div>
                              <div class="line">Turns to a wild of nothing, save of joy,</div>
                              <div class="line">Express'd and not express'd. But when this ring</div>
                              <div class="line">Parts from this finger, then parts life from hence:</div>
                              <div class="line">O, then be bold to say Bassanio's dead!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">NERISSA</div>
                              <div class="line">My lord and lady, it is now our time,</div>
                              <div class="line">That have stood by and seen our wishes prosper,</div>
                              <div class="line">To cry, good joy: good joy, my lord and lady!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GRATIANO</div>
                              <div class="line">My lord Bassanio and my gentle lady,</div>
                              <div class="line">I wish you all the joy that you can wish;</div>
                              <div class="line">For I am sure you can wish none from me:</div>
                              <div class="line">And when your honours mean to solemnize</div>
                              <div class="line">The bargain of your faith, I do beseech you,</div>
                              <div class="line">Even at that time I may be married too.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BASSANIO</div>
                              <div class="line">With all my heart, so thou canst get a wife.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GRATIANO</div>
                              <div class="line">I thank your lordship, you have got me one.</div>
                              <div class="line">My eyes, my lord, can look as swift as yours:</div>
                              <div class="line">You saw the mistress, I beheld the maid;</div>
                              <div class="line">You loved, I loved for intermission.</div>
                              <div class="line">No more pertains to me, my lord, than you.</div>
                              <div class="line">Your fortune stood upon the casket there,</div>
                              <div class="line">And so did mine too, as the matter falls;</div>
                              <div class="line">For wooing here until I sweat again,</div>
                              <div class="line">And sweating until my very roof was dry</div>
                              <div class="line">With oaths of love, at last, if promise last,</div>
                              <div class="line">I got a promise of this fair one here</div>
                              <div class="line">To have her love, provided that your fortune</div>
                              <div class="line">Achieved her mistress.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PORTIA</div>
                              <div class="line">Is this true, Nerissa?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">NERISSA</div>
                              <div class="line">Madam, it is, so you stand pleased withal.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BASSANIO</div>
                              <div class="line">And do you, Gratiano, mean good faith?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GRATIANO</div>
                              <div class="line">Yes, faith, my lord.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BASSANIO</div>
                              <div class="line">Our feast shall be much honour'd in your marriage.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GRATIANO</div>
                              <div class="line">We'll play with them the first boy for a thousand ducats.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">NERISSA</div>
                              <div class="line">What, and stake down?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GRATIANO</div>
                              <div class="line">No; we shall ne'er win at that sport, and stake down.</div>
                              <div class="line">But who comes here? Lorenzo and his infidel? What,</div>
                              <div class="line">and my old Venetian friend Salerio?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter LORENZO, JESSICA, and SALERIO, a Messenger
from Venice</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BASSANIO</div>
                              <div class="line">Lorenzo and Salerio, welcome hither;</div>
                              <div class="line">If that the youth of my new interest here</div>
                              <div class="line">Have power to bid you welcome. By your leave,</div>
                              <div class="line">I bid my very friends and countrymen,</div>
                              <div class="line">Sweet Portia, welcome.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PORTIA</div>
                              <div class="line">So do I, my lord:</div>
                              <div class="line">They are entirely welcome.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LORENZO</div>
                              <div class="line">I thank your honour. For my part, my lord,</div>
                              <div class="line">My purpose was not to have seen you here;</div>
                              <div class="line">But meeting with Salerio by the way,</div>
                              <div class="line">He did entreat me, past all saying nay,</div>
                              <div class="line">To come with him along.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SALERIO</div>
                              <div class="line">I did, my lord;</div>
                              <div class="line">And I have reason for it. Signior Antonio</div>
                              <div class="line">Commends him to you.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Gives Bassanio a letter</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BASSANIO</div>
                              <div class="line">Ere I ope his letter,</div>
                              <div class="line">I pray you, tell me how my good friend doth.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SALERIO</div>
                              <div class="line">Not sick, my lord, unless it be in mind;</div>
                              <div class="line">Nor well, unless in mind: his letter there</div>
                              <div class="line">Will show you his estate.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GRATIANO</div>
                              <div class="line">Nerissa, cheer yon stranger; bid her welcome.</div>
                              <div class="line">Your hand, Salerio: what's the news from Venice?</div>
                              <div class="line">How doth that royal merchant, good Antonio?</div>
                              <div class="line">I know he will be glad of our success;</div>
                              <div class="line">We are the Jasons, we have won the fleece.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SALERIO</div>
                              <div class="line">I would you had won the fleece that he hath lost.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PORTIA</div>
                              <div class="line">There are some shrewd contents in yon same paper,</div>
                              <div class="line">That steals the colour from Bassanio's cheek:</div>
                              <div class="line">Some dear friend dead; else nothing in the world</div>
                              <div class="line">Could turn so much the constitution</div>
                              <div class="line">Of any constant man. What, worse and worse!</div>
                              <div class="line">With leave, Bassanio: I am half yourself,</div>
                              <div class="line">And I must freely have the half of anything</div>
                              <div class="line">That this same paper brings you.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BASSANIO</div>
                              <div class="line">O sweet Portia,</div>
                              <div class="line">Here are a few of the unpleasant'st words</div>
                              <div class="line">That ever blotted paper! Gentle lady,</div>
                              <div class="line">When I did first impart my love to you,</div>
                              <div class="line">I freely told you, all the wealth I had</div>
                              <div class="line">Ran in my veins, I was a gentleman;</div>
                              <div class="line">And then I told you true: and yet, dear lady,</div>
                              <div class="line">Rating myself at nothing, you shall see</div>
                              <div class="line">How much I was a braggart. When I told you</div>
                              <div class="line">My state was nothing, I should then have told you</div>
                              <div class="line">That I was worse than nothing; for, indeed,</div>
                              <div class="line">I have engaged myself to a dear friend,</div>
                              <div class="line">Engaged my friend to his mere enemy,</div>
                              <div class="line">To feed my means. Here is a letter, lady;</div>
                              <div class="line">The paper as the body of my friend,</div>
                              <div class="line">And every word in it a gaping wound,</div>
                              <div class="line">Issuing life-blood. But is it true, Salerio?</div>
                              <div class="line">Have all his ventures fail'd? What, not one hit?</div>
                              <div class="line">From Tripolis, from Mexico and England,</div>
                              <div class="line">From Lisbon, Barbary and India?</div>
                              <div class="line">And not one vessel 'scape the dreadful touch</div>
                              <div class="line">Of merchant-marring rocks?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SALERIO</div>
                              <div class="line">Not one, my lord.</div>
                              <div class="line">Besides, it should appear, that if he had</div>
                              <div class="line">The present money to discharge the Jew,</div>
                              <div class="line">He would not take it. Never did I know</div>
                              <div class="line">A creature, that did bear the shape of man,</div>
                              <div class="line">So keen and greedy to confound a man:</div>
                              <div class="line">He plies the duke at morning and at night,</div>
                              <div class="line">And doth impeach the freedom of the state,</div>
                              <div class="line">If they deny him justice: twenty merchants,</div>
                              <div class="line">The duke himself, and the magnificoes</div>
                              <div class="line">Of greatest port, have all persuaded with him;</div>
                              <div class="line">But none can drive him from the envious plea</div>
                              <div class="line">Of forfeiture, of justice and his bond.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">JESSICA</div>
                              <div class="line">When I was with him I have heard him swear</div>
                              <div class="line">To Tubal and to Chus, his countrymen,</div>
                              <div class="line">That he would rather have Antonio's flesh</div>
                              <div class="line">Than twenty times the value of the sum</div>
                              <div class="line">That he did owe him: and I know, my lord,</div>
                              <div class="line">If law, authority and power deny not,</div>
                              <div class="line">It will go hard with poor Antonio.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PORTIA</div>
                              <div class="line">Is it your dear friend that is thus in trouble?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BASSANIO</div>
                              <div class="line">The dearest friend to me, the kindest man,</div>
                              <div class="line">The best-condition'd and unwearied spirit</div>
                              <div class="line">In doing courtesies, and one in whom</div>
                              <div class="line">The ancient Roman honour more appears</div>
                              <div class="line">Than any that draws breath in Italy.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PORTIA</div>
                              <div class="line">What sum owes he the Jew?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BASSANIO</div>
                              <div class="line">For me three thousand ducats.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PORTIA</div>
                              <div class="line">What, no more?</div>
                              <div class="line">Pay him six thousand, and deface the bond;</div>
                              <div class="line">Double six thousand, and then treble that,</div>
                              <div class="line">Before a friend of this description</div>
                              <div class="line">Shall lose a hair through Bassanio's fault.</div>
                              <div class="line">First go with me to church and call me wife,</div>
                              <div class="line">And then away to Venice to your friend;</div>
                              <div class="line">For never shall you lie by Portia's side</div>
                              <div class="line">With an unquiet soul. You shall have gold</div>
                              <div class="line">To pay the petty debt twenty times over:</div>
                              <div class="line">When it is paid, bring your true friend along.</div>
                              <div class="line">My maid Nerissa and myself meantime</div>
                              <div class="line">Will live as maids and widows. Come, away!</div>
                              <div class="line">For you shall hence upon your wedding-day:</div>
                              <div class="line">Bid your friends welcome, show a merry cheer:</div>
                              <div class="line">Since you are dear bought, I will love you dear.</div>
                              <div class="line">But let me hear the letter of your friend.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BASSANIO</div>
                              <div class="line">
                                 <span>Reads</span>  Sweet Bassanio, my ships have all</div>
                              <div class="line">miscarried, my creditors grow cruel, my estate is</div>
                              <div class="line">very low, my bond to the Jew is forfeit; and since</div>
                              <div class="line">in paying it, it is impossible I should live, all</div>
                              <div class="line">debts are cleared between you and I, if I might but</div>
                              <div class="line">see you at my death. Notwithstanding, use your</div>
                              <div class="line">pleasure: if your love do not persuade you to come,</div>
                              <div class="line">let not my letter.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PORTIA</div>
                              <div class="line">O love, dispatch all business, and be gone!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BASSANIO</div>
                              <div class="line">Since I have your good leave to go away,</div>
                              <div class="line">I will make haste: but, till I come again,</div>
                              <div class="line">No bed shall e'er be guilty of my stay,</div>
                              <div class="line">No rest be interposer 'twixt us twain.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt</p>
                     </div>
                  </section>
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.5.4">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>3. SCENE III.  Venice. A street.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Enter SHYLOCK, SALARINO, ANTONIO, and Gaoler</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SHYLOCK</div>
                              <div class="line">Gaoler, look to him: tell not me of mercy;</div>
                              <div class="line">This is the fool that lent out money gratis:</div>
                              <div class="line">Gaoler, look to him.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ANTONIO</div>
                              <div class="line">Hear me yet, good Shylock.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SHYLOCK</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll have my bond; speak not against my bond:</div>
                              <div class="line">I have sworn an oath that I will have my bond.</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou call'dst me dog before thou hadst a cause;</div>
                              <div class="line">But, since I am a dog, beware my fangs:</div>
                              <div class="line">The duke shall grant me justice. I do wonder,</div>
                              <div class="line">Thou naughty gaoler, that thou art so fond</div>
                              <div class="line">To come abroad with him at his request.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ANTONIO</div>
                              <div class="line">I pray thee, hear me speak.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SHYLOCK</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll have my bond; I will not hear thee speak:</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll have my bond; and therefore speak no more.</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll not be made a soft and dull-eyed fool,</div>
                              <div class="line">To shake the head, relent, and sigh, and yield</div>
                              <div class="line">To Christian intercessors. Follow not;</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll have no speaking: I will have my bond.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exit</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SALARINO</div>
                              <div class="line">It is the most impenetrable cur</div>
                              <div class="line">That ever kept with men.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ANTONIO</div>
                              <div class="line">Let him alone:</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll follow him no more with bootless prayers.</div>
                              <div class="line">He seeks my life; his reason well I know:</div>
                              <div class="line">I oft deliver'd from his forfeitures</div>
                              <div class="line">Many that have at times made moan to me;</div>
                              <div class="line">Therefore he hates me.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SALARINO</div>
                              <div class="line">I am sure the duke</div>
                              <div class="line">Will never grant this forfeiture to hold.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ANTONIO</div>
                              <div class="line">The duke cannot deny the course of law:</div>
                              <div class="line">For the commodity that strangers have</div>
                              <div class="line">With us in Venice, if it be denied,</div>
                              <div class="line">Will much impeach the justice of his state;</div>
                              <div class="line">Since that the trade and profit of the city</div>
                              <div class="line">Consisteth of all nations. Therefore, go:</div>
                              <div class="line">These griefs and losses have so bated me,</div>
                              <div class="line">That I shall hardly spare a pound of flesh</div>
                              <div class="line">To-morrow to my bloody creditor.</div>
                              <div class="line">Well, gaoler, on. Pray God, Bassanio come</div>
                              <div class="line">To see me pay his debt, and then I care not!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt</p>
                     </div>
                  </section>
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.5.5">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>4. SCENE IV.  Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Enter PORTIA, NERISSA, LORENZO, JESSICA, and
BALTHASAR</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LORENZO</div>
                              <div class="line">Madam, although I speak it in your presence,</div>
                              <div class="line">You have a noble and a true conceit</div>
                              <div class="line">Of godlike amity; which appears most strongly</div>
                              <div class="line">In bearing thus the absence of your lord.</div>
                              <div class="line">But if you knew to whom you show this honour,</div>
                              <div class="line">How true a gentleman you send relief,</div>
                              <div class="line">How dear a lover of my lord your husband,</div>
                              <div class="line">I know you would be prouder of the work</div>
                              <div class="line">Than customary bounty can enforce you.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PORTIA</div>
                              <div class="line">I never did repent for doing good,</div>
                              <div class="line">Nor shall not now: for in companions</div>
                              <div class="line">That do converse and waste the time together,</div>
                              <div class="line">Whose souls do bear an equal yoke Of love,</div>
                              <div class="line">There must be needs a like proportion</div>
                              <div class="line">Of lineaments, of manners and of spirit;</div>
                              <div class="line">Which makes me think that this Antonio,</div>
                              <div class="line">Being the bosom lover of my lord,</div>
                              <div class="line">Must needs be like my lord. If it be so,</div>
                              <div class="line">How little is the cost I have bestow'd</div>
                              <div class="line">In purchasing the semblance of my soul</div>
                              <div class="line">From out the state of hellish misery!</div>
                              <div class="line">This comes too near the praising of myself;</div>
                              <div class="line">Therefore no more of it: hear other things.</div>
                              <div class="line">Lorenzo, I commit into your hands</div>
                              <div class="line">The husbandry and manage of my house</div>
                              <div class="line">Until my lord's return: for mine own part,</div>
                              <div class="line">I have toward heaven breathed a secret vow</div>
                              <div class="line">To live in prayer and contemplation,</div>
                              <div class="line">Only attended by Nerissa here,</div>
                              <div class="line">Until her husband and my lord's return:</div>
                              <div class="line">There is a monastery two miles off;</div>
                              <div class="line">And there will we abide. I do desire you</div>
                              <div class="line">Not to deny this imposition;</div>
                              <div class="line">The which my love and some necessity</div>
                              <div class="line">Now lays upon you.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LORENZO</div>
                              <div class="line">Madam, with all my heart;</div>
                              <div class="line">I shall obey you in all fair commands.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PORTIA</div>
                              <div class="line">My people do already know my mind,</div>
                              <div class="line">And will acknowledge you and Jessica</div>
                              <div class="line">In place of Lord Bassanio and myself.</div>
                              <div class="line">And so farewell, till we shall meet again.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LORENZO</div>
                              <div class="line">Fair thoughts and happy hours attend on you!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">JESSICA</div>
                              <div class="line">I wish your ladyship all heart's content.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PORTIA</div>
                              <div class="line">I thank you for your wish, and am well pleased</div>
                              <div class="line">To wish it back on you: fare you well Jessica.</div>
                              <p>Exeunt JESSICA and LORENZO</p>
                              <div class="line">Now, Balthasar,</div>
                              <div class="line">As I have ever found thee honest-true,</div>
                              <div class="line">So let me find thee still. Take this same letter,</div>
                              <div class="line">And use thou all the endeavour of a man</div>
                              <div class="line">In speed to Padua: see thou render this</div>
                              <div class="line">Into my cousin's hand, Doctor Bellario;</div>
                              <div class="line">And, look, what notes and garments he doth give thee,</div>
                              <div class="line">Bring them, I pray thee, with imagined speed</div>
                              <div class="line">Unto the tranect, to the common ferry</div>
                              <div class="line">Which trades to Venice. Waste no time in words,</div>
                              <div class="line">But get thee gone: I shall be there before thee.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BALTHASAR</div>
                              <div class="line">Madam, I go with all convenient speed.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exit</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PORTIA</div>
                              <div class="line">Come on, Nerissa; I have work in hand</div>
                              <div class="line">That you yet know not of: we'll see our husbands</div>
                              <div class="line">Before they think of us.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">NERISSA</div>
                              <div class="line">Shall they see us?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PORTIA</div>
                              <div class="line">They shall, Nerissa; but in such a habit,</div>
                              <div class="line">That they shall think we are accomplished</div>
                              <div class="line">With that we lack. I'll hold thee any wager,</div>
                              <div class="line">When we are both accoutred like young men,</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll prove the prettier fellow of the two,</div>
                              <div class="line">And wear my dagger with the braver grace,</div>
                              <div class="line">And speak between the change of man and boy</div>
                              <div class="line">With a reed voice, and turn two mincing steps</div>
                              <div class="line">Into a manly stride, and speak of frays</div>
                              <div class="line">Like a fine bragging youth, and tell quaint lies,</div>
                              <div class="line">How honourable ladies sought my love,</div>
                              <div class="line">Which I denying, they fell sick and died;</div>
                              <div class="line">I could not do withal; then I'll repent,</div>
                              <div class="line">And wish for all that, that I had not killed them;</div>
                              <div class="line">And twenty of these puny lies I'll tell,</div>
                              <div class="line">That men shall swear I have discontinued school</div>
                              <div class="line">Above a twelvemonth. I have within my mind</div>
                              <div class="line">A thousand raw tricks of these bragging Jacks,</div>
                              <div class="line">Which I will practise.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">NERISSA</div>
                              <div class="line">Why, shall we turn to men?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PORTIA</div>
                              <div class="line">Fie, what a question's that,</div>
                              <div class="line">If thou wert near a lewd interpreter!</div>
                              <div class="line">But come, I'll tell thee all my whole device</div>
                              <div class="line">When I am in my coach, which stays for us</div>
                              <div class="line">At the park gate; and therefore haste away,</div>
                              <div class="line">For we must measure twenty miles to-day.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt</p>
                     </div>
                  </section>
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.5.6">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>5. SCENE V.  The same. A garden.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Enter LAUNCELOT and JESSICA</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LAUNCELOT</div>
                              <div class="line">Yes, truly; for, look you, the sins of the father</div>
                              <div class="line">are to be laid upon the children: therefore, I</div>
                              <div class="line">promise ye, I fear you. I was always plain with</div>
                              <div class="line">you, and so now I speak my agitation of the matter:</div>
                              <div class="line">therefore be of good cheer, for truly I think you</div>
                              <div class="line">are damned. There is but one hope in it that can do</div>
                              <div class="line">you any good; and that is but a kind of bastard</div>
                              <div class="line">hope neither.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">JESSICA</div>
                              <div class="line">And what hope is that, I pray thee?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
