                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PORTIA</div>
                              <div class="line">Clerk, draw a deed of gift.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">SHYLOCK</div>
                              <div class="line">I pray you, give me leave to go from hence;</div>
                              <div class="line">I am not well: send the deed after me,</div>
                              <div class="line">And I will sign it.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DUKE</div>
                              <div class="line">Get thee gone, but do it.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GRATIANO</div>
                              <div class="line">In christening shalt thou have two god-fathers:</div>
                              <div class="line">Had I been judge, thou shouldst have had ten more,</div>
                              <div class="line">To bring thee to the gallows, not the font.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exit SHYLOCK</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DUKE</div>
                              <div class="line">Sir, I entreat you home with me to dinner.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PORTIA</div>
                              <div class="line">I humbly do desire your grace of pardon:</div>
                              <div class="line">I must away this night toward Padua,</div>
                              <div class="line">And it is meet I presently set forth.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DUKE</div>
                              <div class="line">I am sorry that your leisure serves you not.</div>
                              <div class="line">Antonio, gratify this gentleman,</div>
                              <div class="line">For, in my mind, you are much bound to him.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt Duke and his train</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BASSANIO</div>
                              <div class="line">Most worthy gentleman, I and my friend</div>
                              <div class="line">Have by your wisdom been this day acquitted</div>
                              <div class="line">Of grievous penalties; in lieu whereof,</div>
                              <div class="line">Three thousand ducats, due unto the Jew,</div>
                              <div class="line">We freely cope your courteous pains withal.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ANTONIO</div>
                              <div class="line">And stand indebted, over and above,</div>
                              <div class="line">In love and service to you evermore.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PORTIA</div>
                              <div class="line">He is well paid that is well satisfied;</div>
                              <div class="line">And I, delivering you, am satisfied</div>
                              <div class="line">And therein do account myself well paid:</div>
                              <div class="line">My mind was never yet more mercenary.</div>
                              <div class="line">I pray you, know me when we meet again:</div>
                              <div class="line">I wish you well, and so I take my leave.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BASSANIO</div>
                              <div class="line">Dear sir, of force I must attempt you further:</div>
                              <div class="line">Take some remembrance of us, as a tribute,</div>
                              <div class="line">Not as a fee: grant me two things, I pray you,</div>
                              <div class="line">Not to deny me, and to pardon me.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PORTIA</div>
                              <div class="line">You press me far, and therefore I will yield.</div>
                              <p>To ANTONIO</p>
                              <div class="line">Give me your gloves, I'll wear them for your sake;</div>
                              <p>To BASSANIO</p>
                              <div class="line">And, for your love, I'll take this ring from you:</div>
                              <div class="line">Do not draw back your hand; I'll take no more;</div>
                              <div class="line">And you in love shall not deny me this.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BASSANIO</div>
                              <div class="line">This ring, good sir, alas, it is a trifle!</div>
                              <div class="line">I will not shame myself to give you this.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PORTIA</div>
                              <div class="line">I will have nothing else but only this;</div>
                              <div class="line">And now methinks I have a mind to it.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BASSANIO</div>
                              <div class="line">There's more depends on this than on the value.</div>
                              <div class="line">The dearest ring in Venice will I give you,</div>
                              <div class="line">And find it out by proclamation:</div>
                              <div class="line">Only for this, I pray you, pardon me.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PORTIA</div>
                              <div class="line">I see, sir, you are liberal in offers</div>
                              <div class="line">You taught me first to beg; and now methinks</div>
                              <div class="line">You teach me how a beggar should be answer'd.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BASSANIO</div>
                              <div class="line">Good sir, this ring was given me by my wife;</div>
                              <div class="line">And when she put it on, she made me vow</div>
                              <div class="line">That I should neither sell nor give nor lose it.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PORTIA</div>
                              <div class="line">That 'scuse serves many men to save their gifts.</div>
                              <div class="line">An if your wife be not a mad-woman,</div>
                              <div class="line">And know how well I have deserved the ring,</div>
                              <div class="line">She would not hold out enemy for ever,</div>
                              <div class="line">For giving it to me. Well, peace be with you!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt Portia and Nerissa</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ANTONIO</div>
                              <div class="line">My Lord Bassanio, let him have the ring:</div>
                              <div class="line">Let his deservings and my love withal</div>
                              <div class="line">Be valued against your wife's commandment.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BASSANIO</div>
                              <div class="line">Go, Gratiano, run and overtake him;</div>
                              <div class="line">Give him the ring, and bring him, if thou canst,</div>
                              <div class="line">Unto Antonio's house: away! make haste.</div>
                              <p>Exit Gratiano</p>
                              <div class="line">Come, you and I will thither presently;</div>
                              <div class="line">And in the morning early will we both</div>
                              <div class="line">Fly toward Belmont: come, Antonio.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt</p>
                     </div>
                  </section>
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.6.3">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>2. SCENE II.  The same. A street.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Enter PORTIA and NERISSA</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PORTIA</div>
                              <div class="line">Inquire the Jew's house out, give him this deed</div>
                              <div class="line">And let him sign it: we'll away to-night</div>
                              <div class="line">And be a day before our husbands home:</div>
                              <div class="line">This deed will be well welcome to Lorenzo.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter GRATIANO</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GRATIANO</div>
                              <div class="line">Fair sir, you are well o'erta'en</div>
                              <div class="line">My Lord Bassanio upon more advice</div>
                              <div class="line">Hath sent you here this ring, and doth entreat</div>
                              <div class="line">Your company at dinner.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PORTIA</div>
                              <div class="line">That cannot be:</div>
                              <div class="line">His ring I do accept most thankfully:</div>
                              <div class="line">And so, I pray you, tell him: furthermore,</div>
                              <div class="line">I pray you, show my youth old Shylock's house.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GRATIANO</div>
                              <div class="line">That will I do.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">NERISSA</div>
                              <div class="line">Sir, I would speak with you.</div>
                              <p>Aside to PORTIA</p>
                              <div class="line">I'll see if I can get my husband's ring,</div>
                              <div class="line">Which I did make him swear to keep for ever.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PORTIA</div>
                              <div class="line">
                                 <span>Aside to NERISSA</span>  Thou mayst, I warrant.</div>
                              <div class="line">We shall have old swearing</div>
                              <div class="line">That they did give the rings away to men;</div>
                              <div class="line">But we'll outface them, and outswear them too.</div>
                              <p>Aloud</p>
                              <div class="line">Away! make haste: thou knowist where I will tarry.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">NERISSA</div>
                              <div class="line">Come, good sir, will you show me to this house?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt</p>
                     </div>
                  </section>
               </div>
            </article>
            <article class="chapter" id="R.1.7">
               <header class="chapter-titlepage">
                  <h2>Chapter 5. ACT V</h2>
               </header>
               <div class="lists-of-titles">
                  <div class="toc">
                     <p>
                        <b>Table of Contents</b>
                     </p>
                     <ul class="toc">
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.7.2">1. SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                     </ul>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="content">
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.7.2">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>1. SCENE I.  Belmont. Avenue to PORTIA'S house.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Enter LORENZO and JESSICA</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LORENZO</div>
                              <div class="line">The moon shines bright: in such a night as this,</div>
                              <div class="line">When the sweet wind did gently kiss the trees</div>
                              <div class="line">And they did make no noise, in such a night</div>
                              <div class="line">Troilus methinks mounted the Troyan walls</div>
                              <div class="line">And sigh'd his soul toward the Grecian tents,</div>
                              <div class="line">Where Cressid lay that night.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">JESSICA</div>
                              <div class="line">In such a night</div>
                              <div class="line">Did Thisbe fearfully o'ertrip the dew</div>
                              <div class="line">And saw the lion's shadow ere himself</div>
                              <div class="line">And ran dismay'd away.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LORENZO</div>
                              <div class="line">In such a night</div>
                              <div class="line">Stood Dido with a willow in her hand</div>
                              <div class="line">Upon the wild sea banks and waft her love</div>
                              <div class="line">To come again to Carthage.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">JESSICA</div>
                              <div class="line">In such a night</div>
                              <div class="line">Medea gather'd the enchanted herbs</div>
                              <div class="line">That did renew old AEson.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LORENZO</div>
                              <div class="line">In such a night</div>
                              <div class="line">Did Jessica steal from the wealthy Jew</div>
                              <div class="line">And with an unthrift love did run from Venice</div>
                              <div class="line">As far as Belmont.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">JESSICA</div>
                              <div class="line">In such a night</div>
                              <div class="line">Did young Lorenzo swear he loved her well,</div>
                              <div class="line">Stealing her soul with many vows of faith</div>
                              <div class="line">And ne'er a true one.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LORENZO</div>
                              <div class="line">In such a night</div>
                              <div class="line">Did pretty Jessica, like a little shrew,</div>
                              <div class="line">Slander her love, and he forgave it her.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">JESSICA</div>
                              <div class="line">I would out-night you, did no body come;</div>
                              <div class="line">But, hark, I hear the footing of a man.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter STEPHANO</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LORENZO</div>
                              <div class="line">Who comes so fast in silence of the night?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">STEPHANO</div>
                              <div class="line">A friend.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LORENZO</div>
                              <div class="line">A friend! what friend? your name, I pray you, friend?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">STEPHANO</div>
                              <div class="line">Stephano is my name; and I bring word</div>
                              <div class="line">My mistress will before the break of day</div>
                              <div class="line">Be here at Belmont; she doth stray about</div>
                              <div class="line">By holy crosses, where she kneels and prays</div>
                              <div class="line">For happy wedlock hours.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LORENZO</div>
                              <div class="line">Who comes with her?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">STEPHANO</div>
                              <div class="line">None but a holy hermit and her maid.</div>
                              <div class="line">I pray you, is my master yet return'd?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LORENZO</div>
                              <div class="line">He is not, nor we have not heard from him.</div>
                              <div class="line">But go we in, I pray thee, Jessica,</div>
                              <div class="line">And ceremoniously let us prepare</div>
                              <div class="line">Some welcome for the mistress of the house.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter LAUNCELOT</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LAUNCELOT</div>
                              <div class="line">Sola, sola! wo ha, ho! sola, sola!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LORENZO</div>
                              <div class="line">Who calls?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LAUNCELOT</div>
                              <div class="line">Sola! did you see Master Lorenzo?</div>
                              <div class="line">Master Lorenzo, sola, sola!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LORENZO</div>
                              <div class="line">Leave hollaing, man: here.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LAUNCELOT</div>
                              <div class="line">Sola! where? where?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LORENZO</div>
                              <div class="line">Here.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LAUNCELOT</div>
                              <div class="line">Tell him there's a post come from my master, with</div>
                              <div class="line">his horn full of good news: my master will be here</div>
                              <div class="line">ere morning.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exit</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LORENZO</div>
                              <div class="line">Sweet soul, let's in, and there expect their coming.</div>
                              <div class="line">And yet no matter: why should we go in?</div>
                              <div class="line">My friend Stephano, signify, I pray you,</div>
                              <div class="line">Within the house, your mistress is at hand;</div>
                              <div class="line">And bring your music forth into the air.</div>
                              <p>Exit Stephano</p>
                              <div class="line">How sweet the moonlight sleeps upon this bank!</div>
                              <div class="line">Here will we sit and let the sounds of music</div>
                              <div class="line">Creep in our ears: soft stillness and the night</div>
                              <div class="line">Become the touches of sweet harmony.</div>
                              <div class="line">Sit, Jessica. Look how the floor of heaven</div>
                              <div class="line">Is thick inlaid with patines of bright gold:</div>
                              <div class="line">There's not the smallest orb which thou behold'st</div>
                              <div class="line">But in his motion like an angel sings,</div>
                              <div class="line">Still quiring to the young-eyed cherubins;</div>
                              <div class="line">Such harmony is in immortal souls;</div>
                              <div class="line">But whilst this muddy vesture of decay</div>
                              <div class="line">Doth grossly close it in, we cannot hear it.</div>
                              <p>Enter Musicians</p>
                              <div class="line">Come, ho! and wake Diana with a hymn!</div>
                              <div class="line">With sweetest touches pierce your mistress' ear,</div>
                              <div class="line">And draw her home with music.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Music</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">JESSICA</div>
                              <div class="line">I am never merry when I hear sweet music.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LORENZO</div>
                              <div class="line">The reason is, your spirits are attentive:</div>
                              <div class="line">For do but note a wild and wanton herd,</div>
                              <div class="line">Or race of youthful and unhandled colts,</div>
                              <div class="line">Fetching mad bounds, bellowing and neighing loud,</div>
                              <div class="line">Which is the hot condition of their blood;</div>
                              <div class="line">If they but hear perchance a trumpet sound,</div>
                              <div class="line">Or any air of music touch their ears,</div>
                              <div class="line">You shall perceive them make a mutual stand,</div>
                              <div class="line">Their savage eyes turn'd to a modest gaze</div>
                              <div class="line">By the sweet power of music: therefore the poet</div>
                              <div class="line">Did feign that Orpheus drew trees, stones and floods;</div>
                              <div class="line">Since nought so stockish, hard and full of rage,</div>
                              <div class="line">But music for the time doth change his nature.</div>
                              <div class="line">The man that hath no music in himself,</div>
                              <div class="line">Nor is not moved with concord of sweet sounds,</div>
                              <div class="line">Is fit for treasons, stratagems and spoils;</div>
                              <div class="line">The motions of his spirit are dull as night</div>
                              <div class="line">And his affections dark as Erebus:</div>
                              <div class="line">Let no such man be trusted. Mark the music.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter PORTIA and NERISSA</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PORTIA</div>
                              <div class="line">That light we see is burning in my hall.</div>
                              <div class="line">How far that little candle throws his beams!</div>
                              <div class="line">So shines a good deed in a naughty world.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">NERISSA</div>
                              <div class="line">When the moon shone, we did not see the candle.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PORTIA</div>
                              <div class="line">So doth the greater glory dim the less:</div>
                              <div class="line">A substitute shines brightly as a king</div>
                              <div class="line">Unto the king be by, and then his state</div>
                              <div class="line">Empties itself, as doth an inland brook</div>
                              <div class="line">Into the main of waters. Music! hark!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">NERISSA</div>
                              <div class="line">It is your music, madam, of the house.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PORTIA</div>
                              <div class="line">Nothing is good, I see, without respect:</div>
                              <div class="line">Methinks it sounds much sweeter than by day.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">NERISSA</div>
                              <div class="line">Silence bestows that virtue on it, madam.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PORTIA</div>
                              <div class="line">The crow doth sing as sweetly as the lark,</div>
                              <div class="line">When neither is attended, and I think</div>
                              <div class="line">The nightingale, if she should sing by day,</div>
                              <div class="line">When every goose is cackling, would be thought</div>
                              <div class="line">No better a musician than the wren.</div>
                              <div class="line">How many things by season season'd are</div>
                              <div class="line">To their right praise and true perfection!</div>
                              <div class="line">Peace, ho! the moon sleeps with Endymion</div>
                              <div class="line">And would not be awaked.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Music ceases</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LORENZO</div>
                              <div class="line">That is the voice,</div>
                              <div class="line">Or I am much deceived, of Portia.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PORTIA</div>
                              <div class="line">He knows me as the blind man knows the cuckoo,</div>
                              <div class="line">By the bad voice.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LORENZO</div>
                              <div class="line">Dear lady, welcome home.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PORTIA</div>
                              <div class="line">We have been praying for our husbands' healths,</div>
                              <div class="line">Which speed, we hope, the better for our words.</div>
                              <div class="line">Are they return'd?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LORENZO</div>
                              <div class="line">Madam, they are not yet;</div>
                              <div class="line">But there is come a messenger before,</div>
                              <div class="line">To signify their coming.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PORTIA</div>
                              <div class="line">Go in, Nerissa;</div>
                              <div class="line">Give order to my servants that they take</div>
                              <div class="line">No note at all of our being absent hence;</div>
                              <div class="line">Nor you, Lorenzo; Jessica, nor you.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>A tucket sounds</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LORENZO</div>
                              <div class="line">Your husband is at hand; I hear his trumpet:</div>
                              <div class="line">We are no tell-tales, madam; fear you not.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PORTIA</div>
                              <div class="line">This night methinks is but the daylight sick;</div>
                              <div class="line">It looks a little paler: 'tis a day,</div>
                              <div class="line">Such as the day is when the sun is hid.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Enter BASSANIO, ANTONIO, GRATIANO, and
their followers</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BASSANIO</div>
                              <div class="line">We should hold day with the Antipodes,</div>
                              <div class="line">If you would walk in absence of the sun.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PORTIA</div>
                              <div class="line">Let me give light, but let me not be light;</div>
                              <div class="line">For a light wife doth make a heavy husband,</div>
                              <div class="line">And never be Bassanio so for me:</div>
                              <div class="line">But God sort all! You are welcome home, my lord.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BASSANIO</div>
                              <div class="line">I thank you, madam. Give welcome to my friend.</div>
                              <div class="line">This is the man, this is Antonio,</div>
                              <div class="line">To whom I am so infinitely bound.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PORTIA</div>
                              <div class="line">You should in all sense be much bound to him.</div>
                              <div class="line">For, as I hear, he was much bound for you.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ANTONIO</div>
                              <div class="line">No more than I am well acquitted of.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PORTIA</div>
                              <div class="line">Sir, you are very welcome to our house:</div>
                              <div class="line">It must appear in other ways than words,</div>
                              <div class="line">Therefore I scant this breathing courtesy.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GRATIANO</div>
                              <div class="line">
                                 <span>To NERISSA</span>  By yonder moon I swear you do me wrong;</div>
                              <div class="line">In faith, I gave it to the judge's clerk:</div>
                              <div class="line">Would he were gelt that had it, for my part,</div>
                              <div class="line">Since you do take it, love, so much at heart.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PORTIA</div>
                              <div class="line">A quarrel, ho, already! what's the matter?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GRATIANO</div>
                              <div class="line">About a hoop of gold, a paltry ring</div>
                              <div class="line">That she did give me, whose posy was</div>
                              <div class="line">For all the world like cutler's poetry</div>
                              <div class="line">Upon a knife, 'Love me, and leave me not.'</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">NERISSA</div>
                              <div class="line">What talk you of the posy or the value?</div>
                              <div class="line">You swore to me, when I did give it you,</div>
                              <div class="line">That you would wear it till your hour of death</div>
                              <div class="line">And that it should lie with you in your grave:</div>
                              <div class="line">Though not for me, yet for your vehement oaths,</div>
                              <div class="line">You should have been respective and have kept it.</div>
                              <div class="line">Gave it a judge's clerk! no, God's my judge,</div>
                              <div class="line">The clerk will ne'er wear hair on's face that had it.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GRATIANO</div>
                              <div class="line">He will, an if he live to be a man.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">NERISSA</div>
                              <div class="line">Ay, if a woman live to be a man.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GRATIANO</div>
                              <div class="line">Now, by this hand, I gave it to a youth,</div>
                              <div class="line">A kind of boy, a little scrubbed boy,</div>
                              <div class="line">No higher than thyself; the judge's clerk,</div>
                              <div class="line">A prating boy, that begg'd it as a fee:</div>
                              <div class="line">I could not for my heart deny it him.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PORTIA</div>
                              <div class="line">You were to blame, I must be plain with you,</div>
                              <div class="line">To part so slightly with your wife's first gift:</div>
                              <div class="line">A thing stuck on with oaths upon your finger</div>
                              <div class="line">And so riveted with faith unto your flesh.</div>
                              <div class="line">I gave my love a ring and made him swear</div>
                              <div class="line">Never to part with it; and here he stands;</div>
                              <div class="line">I dare be sworn for him he would not leave it</div>
                              <div class="line">Nor pluck it from his finger, for the wealth</div>
                              <div class="line">That the world masters. Now, in faith, Gratiano,</div>
                              <div class="line">You give your wife too unkind a cause of grief:</div>
                              <div class="line">An 'twere to me, I should be mad at it.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BASSANIO</div>
                              <div class="line">
                                 <span>Aside</span>  Why, I were best to cut my left hand off</div>
                              <div class="line">And swear I lost the ring defending it.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GRATIANO</div>
                              <div class="line">My Lord Bassanio gave his ring away</div>
                              <div class="line">Unto the judge that begg'd it and indeed</div>
                              <div class="line">Deserved it too; and then the boy, his clerk,</div>
                              <div class="line">That took some pains in writing, he begg'd mine;</div>
                              <div class="line">And neither man nor master would take aught</div>
                              <div class="line">But the two rings.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PORTIA</div>
                              <div class="line">What ring gave you my lord?</div>
                              <div class="line">Not that, I hope, which you received of me.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BASSANIO</div>
                              <div class="line">If I could add a lie unto a fault,</div>
                              <div class="line">I would deny it; but you see my finger</div>
                              <div class="line">Hath not the ring upon it; it is gone.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PORTIA</div>
                              <div class="line">Even so void is your false heart of truth.</div>
                              <div class="line">By heaven, I will ne'er come in your bed</div>
                              <div class="line">Until I see the ring.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">NERISSA</div>
                              <div class="line">Nor I in yours</div>
                              <div class="line">Till I again see mine.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BASSANIO</div>
                              <div class="line">Sweet Portia,</div>
                              <div class="line">If you did know to whom I gave the ring,</div>
                              <div class="line">If you did know for whom I gave the ring</div>
                              <div class="line">And would conceive for what I gave the ring</div>
                              <div class="line">And how unwillingly I left the ring,</div>
                              <div class="line">When nought would be accepted but the ring,</div>
                              <div class="line">You would abate the strength of your displeasure.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PORTIA</div>
                              <div class="line">If you had known the virtue of the ring,</div>
                              <div class="line">Or half her worthiness that gave the ring,</div>
                              <div class="line">Or your own honour to contain the ring,</div>
                              <div class="line">You would not then have parted with the ring.</div>
                              <div class="line">What man is there so much unreasonable,</div>
                              <div class="line">If you had pleased to have defended it</div>
                              <div class="line">With any terms of zeal, wanted the modesty</div>
                              <div class="line">To urge the thing held as a ceremony?</div>
                              <div class="line">Nerissa teaches me what to believe:</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll die for't but some woman had the ring.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BASSANIO</div>
                              <div class="line">No, by my honour, madam, by my soul,</div>
                              <div class="line">No woman had it, but a civil doctor,</div>
                              <div class="line">Which did refuse three thousand ducats of me</div>
                              <div class="line">And begg'd the ring; the which I did deny him</div>
                              <div class="line">And suffer'd him to go displeased away;</div>
                              <div class="line">Even he that did uphold the very life</div>
                              <div class="line">Of my dear friend. What should I say, sweet lady?</div>
                              <div class="line">I was enforced to send it after him;</div>
                              <div class="line">I was beset with shame and courtesy;</div>
                              <div class="line">My honour would not let ingratitude</div>
                              <div class="line">So much besmear it. Pardon me, good lady;</div>
                              <div class="line">For, by these blessed candles of the night,</div>
                              <div class="line">Had you been there, I think you would have begg'd</div>
                              <div class="line">The ring of me to give the worthy doctor.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PORTIA</div>
                              <div class="line">Let not that doctor e'er come near my house:</div>
                              <div class="line">Since he hath got the jewel that I loved,</div>
                              <div class="line">And that which you did swear to keep for me,</div>
                              <div class="line">I will become as liberal as you;</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll not deny him any thing I have,</div>
                              <div class="line">No, not my body nor my husband's bed:</div>
                              <div class="line">Know him I shall, I am well sure of it:</div>
                              <div class="line">Lie not a night from home; watch me like Argus:</div>
                              <div class="line">If you do not, if I be left alone,</div>
                              <div class="line">Now, by mine honour, which is yet mine own,</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll have that doctor for my bedfellow.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">NERISSA</div>
                              <div class="line">And I his clerk; therefore be well advised</div>
                              <div class="line">How you do leave me to mine own protection.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GRATIANO</div>
                              <div class="line">Well, do you so; let not me take him, then;</div>
                              <div class="line">For if I do, I'll mar the young clerk's pen.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ANTONIO</div>
                              <div class="line">I am the unhappy subject of these quarrels.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PORTIA</div>
                              <div class="line">Sir, grieve not you; you are welcome notwithstanding.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BASSANIO</div>
                              <div class="line">Portia, forgive me this enforced wrong;</div>
                              <div class="line">And, in the hearing of these many friends,</div>
                              <div class="line">I swear to thee, even by thine own fair eyes,</div>
                              <div class="line">Wherein I see myself--</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PORTIA</div>
                              <div class="line">Mark you but that!</div>
                              <div class="line">In both my eyes he doubly sees himself;</div>
                              <div class="line">In each eye, one: swear by your double self,</div>
                              <div class="line">And there's an oath of credit.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BASSANIO</div>
                              <div class="line">Nay, but hear me:</div>
                              <div class="line">Pardon this fault, and by my soul I swear</div>
                              <div class="line">I never more will break an oath with thee.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ANTONIO</div>
                              <div class="line">I once did lend my body for his wealth;</div>
                              <div class="line">Which, but for him that had your husband's ring,</div>
                              <div class="line">Had quite miscarried: I dare be bound again,</div>
                              <div class="line">My soul upon the forfeit, that your lord</div>
                              <div class="line">Will never more break faith advisedly.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PORTIA</div>
                              <div class="line">Then you shall be his surety. Give him this</div>
                              <div class="line">And bid him keep it better than the other.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ANTONIO</div>
                              <div class="line">Here, Lord Bassanio; swear to keep this ring.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BASSANIO</div>
                              <div class="line">By heaven, it is the same I gave the doctor!</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PORTIA</div>
                              <div class="line">I had it of him: pardon me, Bassanio;</div>
                              <div class="line">For, by this ring, the doctor lay with me.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">NERISSA</div>
                              <div class="line">And pardon me, my gentle Gratiano;</div>
                              <div class="line">For that same scrubbed boy, the doctor's clerk,</div>
                              <div class="line">In lieu of this last night did lie with me.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GRATIANO</div>
                              <div class="line">Why, this is like the mending of highways</div>
                              <div class="line">In summer, where the ways are fair enough:</div>
                              <div class="line">What, are we cuckolds ere we have deserved it?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PORTIA</div>
                              <div class="line">Speak not so grossly. You are all amazed:</div>
                              <div class="line">Here is a letter; read it at your leisure;</div>
                              <div class="line">It comes from Padua, from Bellario:</div>
                              <div class="line">There you shall find that Portia was the doctor,</div>
                              <div class="line">Nerissa there her clerk: Lorenzo here</div>
                              <div class="line">Shall witness I set forth as soon as you</div>
                              <div class="line">And even but now return'd; I have not yet</div>
                              <div class="line">Enter'd my house. Antonio, you are welcome;</div>
                              <div class="line">And I have better news in store for you</div>
                              <div class="line">Than you expect: unseal this letter soon;</div>
                              <div class="line">There you shall find three of your argosies</div>
                              <div class="line">Are richly come to harbour suddenly:</div>
                              <div class="line">You shall not know by what strange accident</div>
                              <div class="line">I chanced on this letter.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ANTONIO</div>
                              <div class="line">I am dumb.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BASSANIO</div>
                              <div class="line">Were you the doctor and I knew you not?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GRATIANO</div>
                              <div class="line">Were you the clerk that is to make me cuckold?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">NERISSA</div>
                              <div class="line">Ay, but the clerk that never means to do it,</div>
                              <div class="line">Unless he live until he be a man.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">BASSANIO</div>
                              <div class="line">Sweet doctor, you shall be my bed-fellow:</div>
                              <div class="line">When I am absent, then lie with my wife.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ANTONIO</div>
                              <div class="line">Sweet lady, you have given me life and living;</div>
                              <div class="line">For here I read for certain that my ships</div>
                              <div class="line">Are safely come to road.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PORTIA</div>
                              <div class="line">How now, Lorenzo!</div>
                              <div class="line">My clerk hath some good comforts too for you.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">NERISSA</div>
                              <div class="line">Ay, and I'll give them him without a fee.</div>
                              <div class="line">There do I give to you and Jessica,</div>
                              <div class="line">From the rich Jew, a special deed of gift,</div>
                              <div class="line">After his death, of all he dies possess'd of.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">LORENZO</div>
                              <div class="line">Fair ladies, you drop manna in the way</div>
                              <div class="line">Of starved people.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">PORTIA</div>
                              <div class="line">It is almost morning,</div>
                              <div class="line">And yet I am sure you are not satisfied</div>
                              <div class="line">Of these events at full. Let us go in;</div>
                              <div class="line">And charge us there upon inter'gatories,</div>
                              <div class="line">And we will answer all things faithfully.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">GRATIANO</div>
                              <div class="line">Let it be so: the first inter'gatory</div>
                              <div class="line">That my Nerissa shall be sworn on is,</div>
                              <div class="line">Whether till the next night she had rather stay,</div>
                              <div class="line">Or go to bed now, being two hours to day:</div>
                              <div class="line">But were the day come, I should wish it dark,</div>
                              <div class="line">That I were couching with the doctor's clerk.</div>
                              <div class="line">Well, while I live I'll fear no other thing</div>
                              <div class="line">So sore as keeping safe Nerissa's ring.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt</p>
                     </div>
                  </section>
               </div>
            </article>
         </div>
      </article>
      <script src="../../resources/js/prism.js"/>
   </body>
</html>
The “current” CSS styling is applied to the this entire document; the results in this column may be anomalous. Also, image links are broken in this column. 

The Merchant of Venice

Table of Contents

  • 1. Dramatis Personae

    • 1. SCENE I. Venice. A street.
    • 2. SCENE II: Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
    • 3. SCENE III. Venice. A public place.
  • 2. ACT II
    • 1. SCENE I. Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
    • 2. SCENE II. Venice. A street.
    • 3. SCENE III. The same. A room in SHYLOCK'S house.
    • 4. SCENE IV. The same. A street.
    • 5. SCENE V. The same. Before SHYLOCK'S house.
    • 6. SCENE VI. The same.
    • 7. SCENE VII. Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
    • 8. SCENE VIII. Venice. A street.
    • 9. SCENE IX. Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
  • 3. ACT III
    • 1. SCENE I. Venice. A street.
    • 2. SCENE II. Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.

    • 4. SCENE IV. Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
    • 5. SCENE V. The same. A garden.
  • 4. ACT IV
    • 1. SCENE I. Venice. A court of justice.
    • 2. SCENE II. The same. A street.
  • 5. ACT V

Dramatis Personae

The DUKE OF VENICE.

The PRINCE OF MOROCCO The PRINCE OF ARRAGON suitors to Portia.

ANTONIO, a merchant of Venice.

BASSANIO, his friend, suitor likewise to Portia.

SALANIO SALARINO GRATIANO SALERIO friends to Antonio and Bassanio.

LORENZO, in love with Jessica.

SHYLOCK, a rich Jew.

TUBAL, a Jew, his friend.

LAUNCELOT GOBBO, the clown, servant to SHYLOCK.

OLD GOBBO, father to Launcelot.

LEONARDO, servant to BASSANIO.

BALTHASAR STEPHANO servants to PORTIA.

PORTIA, a rich heiress.

NERISSA, her waiting-maid.

JESSICA, daughter to SHYLOCK.

Magnificoes of Venice, Officers of the Court of Justice, Gaoler, Servants to Portia, and other Attendants.

SCENE Partly at Venice, and partly at Belmont, the seat of PORTIA, on the Continent.

Chapter 1. ACT I

Table of Contents

  • 1. SCENE I. Venice. A street.
  • 2. SCENE II: Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.
  • 3. SCENE III. Venice. A public place.

1. SCENE I. Venice. A street.

Enter ANTONIO, SALARINO, and SALANIO

ANTONIO
In sooth, I know not why I am so sad:
It wearies me; you say it wearies you;
But how I caught it, found it, or came by it,
What stuff 'tis made of, whereof it is born,
I am to learn;
And such a want-wit sadness makes of me,
That I have much ado to know myself.
SALARINO
Your mind is tossing on the ocean;
There, where your argosies with portly sail,
Like signiors and rich burghers on the flood,
Or, as it were, the pageants of the sea,
Do overpeer the petty traffickers,
That curtsy to them, do them reverence,
As they fly by them with their woven wings.
SALANIO
Believe me, sir, had I such venture forth,
The better part of my affections would
Be with my hopes abroad. I should be still
Plucking the grass, to know where sits the wind,
Peering in maps for ports and piers and roads;
And every object that might make me fear
Misfortune to my ventures, out of doubt
Would make me sad.
SALARINO
My wind cooling my broth
Would blow me to an ague, when I thought
What harm a wind too great at sea might do.
I should not see the sandy hour-glass run,
But I should think of shallows and of flats,
And see my wealthy Andrew dock'd in sand,
Vailing her high-top lower than her ribs
To kiss her burial. Should I go to church
And see the holy edifice of stone,
And not bethink me straight of dangerous rocks,
Which touching but my gentle vessel's side,
Would scatter all her spices on the stream,
Enrobe the roaring waters with my silks,
And, in a word, but even now worth this,
And now worth nothing? Shall I have the thought
To think on this, and shall I lack the thought
That such a thing bechanced would make me sad?
But tell not me; I know, Antonio
Is sad to think upon his merchandise.
ANTONIO
Believe me, no: I thank my fortune for it,
My ventures are not in one bottom trusted,
Nor to one place; nor is my whole estate
Upon the fortune of this present year:
Therefore my merchandise makes me not sad.
SALARINO
Why, then you are in love.
ANTONIO
Fie, fie!
SALARINO
Not in love neither? Then let us say you are sad,
Because you are not merry: and 'twere as easy
For you to laugh and leap and say you are merry,
Because you are not sad. Now, by two-headed Janus,
Nature hath framed strange fellows in her time:
Some that will evermore peep through their eyes
And laugh like parrots at a bag-piper,
And other of such vinegar aspect
That they'll not show their teeth in way of smile,
Though Nestor swear the jest be laughable.

Enter BASSANIO, LORENZO, and GRATIANO

SALANIO
Here comes Bassanio, your most noble kinsman,
Gratiano and Lorenzo. Fare ye well:
We leave you now with better company.
SALARINO
I would have stay'd till I had made you merry,
If worthier friends had not prevented me.
ANTONIO
Your worth is very dear in my regard.
I take it, your own business calls on you
And you embrace the occasion to depart.
SALARINO
Good morrow, my good lords.
BASSANIO
Good signiors both, when shall we laugh? say, when?
You grow exceeding strange: must it be so?
SALARINO
We'll make our leisures to attend on yours.

Exeunt Salarino and Salanio

LORENZO
My Lord Bassanio, since you have found Antonio,
We two will leave you: but at dinner-time,
I pray you, have in mind where we must meet.
BASSANIO
I will not fail you.
GRATIANO
You look not well, Signior Antonio;
You have too much respect upon the world:
They lose it that do buy it with much care:
Believe me, you are marvellously changed.
ANTONIO
I hold the world but as the world, Gratiano;
A stage where every man must play a part,
And mine a sad one.
GRATIANO
Let me play the fool:
With mirth and laughter let old wrinkles come,
And let my liver rather heat with wine
Than my heart cool with mortifying groans.
Why should a man, whose blood is warm within,
Sit like his grandsire cut in alabaster?
Sleep when he wakes and creep into the jaundice
By being peevish? I tell thee what, Antonio--
I love thee, and it is my love that speaks--
There are a sort of men whose visages
Do cream and mantle like a standing pond,
And do a wilful stillness entertain,
With purpose to be dress'd in an opinion
Of wisdom, gravity, profound conceit,
As who should say 'I am Sir Oracle,
And when I ope my lips let no dog bark!'
O my Antonio, I do know of these
That therefore only are reputed wise
For saying nothing; when, I am very sure,
If they should speak, would almost damn those ears,
Which, hearing them, would call their brothers fools.
I'll tell thee more of this another time:
But fish not, with this melancholy bait,
For this fool gudgeon, this opinion.
Come, good Lorenzo. Fare ye well awhile:
I'll end my exhortation after dinner.
LORENZO
Well, we will leave you then till dinner-time:
I must be one of these same dumb wise men,
For Gratiano never lets me speak.
GRATIANO
Well, keep me company but two years moe,
Thou shalt not know the sound of thine own tongue.
ANTONIO
Farewell: I'll grow a talker for this gear.
GRATIANO
Thanks, i' faith, for silence is only commendable
In a neat's tongue dried and a maid not vendible.

Exeunt GRATIANO and LORENZO

ANTONIO
Is that any thing now?
BASSANIO
Gratiano speaks an infinite deal of nothing, more
than any man in all Venice. His reasons are as two
grains of wheat hid in two bushels of chaff: you
shall seek all day ere you find them, and when you
have them, they are not worth the search.
ANTONIO
Well, tell me now what lady is the same
To whom you swore a secret pilgrimage,
That you to-day promised to tell me of?
BASSANIO
'Tis not unknown to you, Antonio,
How much I have disabled mine estate,
By something showing a more swelling port
Than my faint means would grant continuance:
Nor do I now make moan to be abridged
From such a noble rate; but my chief care
Is to come fairly off from the great debts
Wherein my time something too prodigal
Hath left me gaged. To you, Antonio,
I owe the most, in money and in love,
And from your love I have a warranty
To unburden all my plots and purposes
How to get clear of all the debts I owe.
ANTONIO
I pray you, good Bassanio, let me know it;
And if it stand, as you yourself still do,
Within the eye of honour, be assured,
My purse, my person, my extremest means,
Lie all unlock'd to your occasions.
BASSANIO
In my school-days, when I had lost one shaft,
I shot his fellow of the self-same flight
The self-same way with more advised watch,
To find the other forth, and by adventuring both
I oft found both: I urge this childhood proof,
Because what follows is pure innocence.
I owe you much, and, like a wilful youth,
That which I owe is lost; but if you please
To shoot another arrow that self way
Which you did shoot the first, I do not doubt,
As I will watch the aim, or to find both
Or bring your latter hazard back again
And thankfully rest debtor for the first.
ANTONIO
You know me well, and herein spend but time
To wind about my love with circumstance;
And out of doubt you do me now more wrong
In making question of my uttermost
Than if you had made waste of all I have:
Then do but say to me what I should do
That in your knowledge may by me be done,
And I am prest unto it: therefore, speak.
BASSANIO
In Belmont is a lady richly left;
And she is fair, and, fairer than that word,
Of wondrous virtues: sometimes from her eyes
I did receive fair speechless messages:
Her name is Portia, nothing undervalued
To Cato's daughter, Brutus' Portia:
Nor is the wide world ignorant of her worth,
For the four winds blow in from every coast
Renowned suitors, and her sunny locks
Hang on her temples like a golden fleece;
Which makes her seat of Belmont Colchos' strand,
And many Jasons come in quest of her.
O my Antonio, had I but the means
To hold a rival place with one of them,
I have a mind presages me such thrift,
That I should questionless be fortunate!
ANTONIO
Thou know'st that all my fortunes are at sea;
Neither have I money nor commodity
To raise a present sum: therefore go forth;
Try what my credit can in Venice do:
That shall be rack'd, even to the uttermost,
To furnish thee to Belmont, to fair Portia.
Go, presently inquire, and so will I,
Where money is, and I no question make
To have it of my trust or for my sake.

Exeunt

2. SCENE II: Belmont. A room in PORTIA'S house.

Enter PORTIA and NERISSA

PORTIA
By my troth, Nerissa, my little body is aweary of
this great world.
NERISSA
You would be, sweet madam, if your miseries were in
the same abundance as your good fortunes are: and
yet, for aught I see, they are as sick that surfeit
with too much as they that starve with nothing. It
is no mean happiness therefore, to be seated in the
mean: superfluity comes sooner by white hairs, but
competency lives longer.
PORTIA
Good sentences and well pronounced.
NERISSA
They would be better, if well followed.
PORTIA
If to do were as easy as to know what were good to
do, chapels had been churches and poor men's
cottages princes' palaces. It is a good divine that
follows his own instructions: I can easier teach
twenty what were good to be done, than be one of the
twenty to follow mine own teaching. The brain may
devise laws for the blood, but a hot temper leaps
o'er a cold decree: such a hare is madness the
youth, to skip o'er the meshes of good counsel the
cripple. But this reasoning is not in the fashion to
choose me a husband. O me, the word 'choose!' I may
neither choose whom I would nor refuse whom I
dislike; so is the will of a living daughter curbed
by the will of a dead father. Is it not hard,
Nerissa, that I cannot choose one nor refuse none?
NERISSA
Your father was ever virtuous; and holy men at their
death have good inspirations: therefore the lottery,
that he hath devised in these three chests of gold,
silver and lead, whereof who chooses his meaning
chooses you, will, no doubt, never be chosen by any
rightly but one who shall rightly love. But what
